air.description: Contrary to the name of this website, air can't be spawned as an item in your inventory. It is used as a block to represent, well, air! It can't be seen and is non-solid (so you can walk through it).

stone.description: Stone, not to be confused with cobblestone, can only be obtained when a stoneblock is broken with a silk touch pickaxe. It is required for many redstone items such as the comparator, and decorative items like stonebricks.

properties.Recipes Used In: Stone Slab, Stone Pressure Plate, Stone Button, Stone Bricks, Redstone Repeater, Redstone Comparator, Stone Stairs, Stonecutter

granite.description: Granite is similar to the stone block, but has less uses (currently). It is primarily used as a decorative block, but also can be used instead of stone in a few crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Granite, Granite Wall, Granite Stairs, Granite Slab

polished-granite.description: Polished granite has all the same properties as granite (it can be used interchangeably in crafting recipes). It is currently primarily a decorative block but it is believed that Mojang have plans to change this in future.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Granite Stairs, Polished Granite Slab

diorite.description: Diorite is similar to the stone block, but has less uses (currently). It is primarily used as a decorative block, but also can be used instead of stone in a few crafting recipes. It can also be used to make andesite.

properties.Recipes Used In: Granite, Polished Diorite, Andesite, Diorite Wall, Diorite Stairs, Diorite Slab

polished-diorite.description: Polished diorite has all the same properties as diorite (it can be used interchangeably in crafting recipes). It is currently primarily a decorative block but it is believed that Mojang have plans to change this in future.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Diorite Stairs, Polished Diorite Slab

andesite.description: Andesite is similar to the stone block, but has less uses (currently). It is primarily used as a decorative block, but also can be used instead of stone in a few crafting recipes. It can also be used to make andesite.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Andesite, Andesite Wall, Andesite Stairs, Andesite Slab

polished-andesite.description: Polished andesite has all the same properties as andesite (it can be used interchangeably in crafting recipes). It is currently primarily a decorative block but it is believed that Mojang have plans to change this in future.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Andesite Stairs, Polished Andesite Slab

grass-block.description: Grass is an essential block in Minecraft. Not only was it one of the first blocks introduced to the game, but it is required to plant seeds. Right clicking a grass block with bone meal creates tall grass. It can also be eaten by sheep.

dirt.description: Dirt is obtained when a grass block is mined. Dirt is essential for farming and can be used to make course dirt.

coarse-dirt.description: Coarse dirt is made with regular dirt and has the added chance of growing farming items like saplings.

podzol.description: Podzol only generates in mega taiga biomes. It is used to grow mushrooms, as on podzol, they will grow regardless of light level.

cobblestone.description: Cobblestone is obtained by mining regular stone with any pickaxe. It can be used to make stone tools, furnaces and other essential Minecraft items.

oak-sapling.description: Saplings are used to grow trees. They can be placed on dirt, grass and other similar blocks. When right clicked with bonemeal, they grow instantly.

spruce-sapling.description: Saplings are used to grow trees. They can be placed on dirt, grass and other similar blocks. When right clicked with bonemeal, they grow instantly.

bedrock.description: Bedrock cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft. It covers the lowest point of the world to prevent people from falling in the void. It cannot be broken in survival mode.

sand.description: Sand is found in the desert and near the ocean/rivers. It is used to make glass (by smelting it in a furnace). It is also one of the few blocks to respond to gravity - if it does not have a supprting block underneath it, it will fall to the ground.

properties.Recipes Used In: Sandstone, TNT, White Concrete Powder, Orange Concrete Powder, Magenta Concrete Powder, Light Blue Concrete Powder, Yellow Concrete Powder, Lime Concrete Powder, Pink Concrete Powder, Gray Concrete Powder, Light Gray Concrete Powder, Cyan Concrete Powder, Purple Concrete Powder, Blue Concrete Powder, Brown Concrete Powder, Green Concrete Powder, Red Concrete Powder, Black Concrete Powder

red-sand.description: Red sand is very similar to regular sand. The only differences between red sand and regular sand are the textures, and red sand's inability to be used to craft concrete.

gravel.description: Gravel, like sand, is one of the few blocks in Minecraft that responds to gravity. Despite being in the game for a long time, its only real use is to make concrete. It can also be traded with villagers for emeralds.

properties.Recipes Used In: Coarse Dirt, White Concrete Powder, Orange Concrete Powder, Magenta Concrete Powder, Light Blue Concrete Powder, Yellow Concrete Powder, Lime Concrete Powder, Pink Concrete Powder, Gray Concrete Powder, Light Gray Concrete Powder, Cyan Concrete Powder, Purple Concrete Powder, Blue Concrete Powder, Brown Concrete Powder, Green Concrete Powder, Red Concrete Powder, Black Concrete Powder

gold-ore.description: Gold ore can be smelted in a furnace to make golden ingots. Before it has been smelted, it does not much use. It is about five times rarer than iron ore, and only spawns below Y 32.

iron-ore.description: Iron ore, similar to gold ore, can be smelted in a furnace to make iron ingots. Before it has been smelted, it does not much use.

coal-ore.description: This block can only be obtained when it is mined with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. When mined, it drops coal, which can be used as a fuel in a furnace.

oak-log.description: Wood is the primary constituent of trees in Minecraft. It can be broken with your hands, but using an axe is much faster. When placed in a crafting square, it yields 4 wooden planks which is an ingredient in many important crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Oak Planks, Oak Wood, Smoker, Campfire, Soul Campfire

spruce-log.description: Wood is the primary constituent of trees in Minecraft. It can be broken with your hands, but using an axe is much faster. When placed in a crafting square, it yields 4 wooden planks which is an ingredient in many important crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Acacia Planks, Acacia Wood, Smoker, Campfire, Soul Campfire

dark-oak-log.description: Dark oak logs only generate as part of dark oak trees. The dark oak tree can be found in the roofed forest biome. They act just like regular logs, but are retextured.

properties.Recipes Used In: Oak Planks, Smoker, Campfire, Soul Campfire

oak-leaves.description: Oak leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

spruce-leaves.description: Leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

birch-leaves.description: Leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

jungle-leaves.description: Leaves are a part of trees in Minecraft. When broken, there is a 1/200 chance that an apple will be dropped. The leaves block itself cannot be obtained unless shears are used to break it.

acacia-leaves.description: Acacia leaves are one of the most recently added leave textures. The block itself acts just like regular leaves, but only generates in acacia tree structures.

dark-oak-leaves.description: Dark oak leaves are one of the most recently added leave textures. The block itself acts just like regular leaves, but only generates in dark oak tree structures.

sponge.description: Sponge can be used to soak up water in Minecraft. Whilst an unsoaked sponge cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft, placing a wet sponge in a furnace yields this block (which can then be used to soak up water).

wet-sponge.description: Wet sponges can be obtained from ocean monuments and are dropped by elder guardians upon death. They are also formed when a sponge becomes fully soaked. To obtain a regular sponge from a wet sponge, the wet sponge must be placedin a furnace (with appropriate fuel).

glass.description: Glass is obtained when sand is smelted in a furnace. When broken without a silk touch pickaxe, it does not yield the glass block. It is a transparent block, and used in crafting recipes for beacons, stained glass, daylight sensors, glass bottles, end crystals and various other items.

properties.Recipes Used In: Glass Pane, Beacon, Daylight Detector, White Stained Glass, Orange Stained Glass, Magenta Stained Glass, Light Blue Stained Glass, Yellow Stained Glass, Lime Stained Glass, Pink Stained Glass, Gray Stained Glass, Light Gray Stained Glass, Cyan Stained Glass, Purple Stained Glass, Blue Stained Glass, Brown Stained Glass, Green Stained Glass, Red Stained Glass, Black Stained Glass, Glass Bottle, End Crystal

lapis-lazuli-ore.description: The lapis lazuli ore block can only be obtained when lapis lazuli is mined with a silk touch pickaxe. It does not have any purpose when in item form.

lapis-lazuli-block.description: The lapis lazuli block can be made by placing 9 lapis lazulis in the crafting table (one in each square). It is primarily a decorative block.. but could be used to conserve storage space (holds 9 lapis lazulis).

dispenser.description: It should come as no surprise to you that the dispenser block dispenses items. It can be activated with redstone. In the cases of some items, like arrows and fire charges, it has special behaviour (e.g. shooting the item rather than just dropping it).

sandstone.description: Sandstone generates naturally in beaches and deserts, along with structures like temples. It is primarily a decorative block as it serves little to no purpose.

properties.Recipes Used In: Cut Sandstone, Sandstone Slab, Sandstone Stairs, Sandstone Wall

chiseled-sandstone.description: Chiseled sandstone can be made by placing 2 sandstone slabs into a crafting menu. It is primarily a decorative block as it serves little to no purpose.

cut-sandstone.description: Cut sandstone, formerly known as smooth sandstone, can be crafted by placing 4 (2x2) sandstone blocks in a crafting table. It is primarily a decorative block as it serves little to no purpose.

note-block.description: Note blocks can produce sounds when punched. The sound they produce can be changed by right clicking the block.

powered-rail.description: Powered rails can be used to propel minecarts on a track. They also interact with redstone and can be turned off/on.

detector-rail.description: Detector rails can detect when a minecart runs over them. They can be used in redstone circuits, which allows for redstone contraptions that react to minecarts.

sticky-piston.description: Sticky pistons act like regular pistons (the 'arm' can be pushed forwards and backwards), but the 'sticky' substance on the arm latches onto the block that is adjacent to the arm when extended, and pulls it back when contracted.

cobweb.description: Cobwebs are found in mine shafts. They can be placed inside a crafting square to yield 9 string. When inside a cobweb block, your movement is slowed.

fern.description: Ferns can only be obtained when the block is broken with shears. They spawn in forest biomes. When broken, there is a chance that seeds (wheat) will be dropped.

dead-bush.description: Dead bushes are found in the desert, and other biomes like mesas and mega taigas. They can only be obtained by breaking them with shears. They serve no purpose outside of being a decorative item.

seagrass.description: Seagrass was introduced in Minecraft Update Aquatic. It has the same properties as regular grass, but grows underwater.

sea-pickle.description: Sea pickles can be used to create lime dye. They are also light sources.

piston.description: When activated with redstone, a piston will push an arm out in the direction it is facing. This arm will push the block infront of it forwards one block.

white-wool.description: Wool can be crafted with string, which can be obtained from sheep or spiders. Dyed wool is obtained by placing a dye and a wool block (of any colour) into the same crafting table.

dandelion.description: The dandelion, also known as the yellow flower is used to make the dandelion yellow dye in Minecraft. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

poppy.description: The poppy, also known as the red flower is used to make the poppy red dye in Minecraft. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

blue-orchid.description: The blue orchid flower is used to create light blue dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

allium.description: The allium flower is used to create purple dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

azure-bluet.description: The azure bluet flower is used to create light gray dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

red-tulip.description: The red tulip flower is used to create rose red dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

orange-tulip.description: The orange tulip flower is used to create orange dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

white-tulip.description: The white tulip flower is used to create light gray dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

pink-tulip.description: The pink tulip flower is used to create pink dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

oxeye-daisy.description: The oxeye daisy flower is used to create light gray dye. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals!

brown-mushroom.description: The brown mushroom in Minecraft is used to create mushroom stew, fermented spider eyes and rabbit stew. It can be found in swamp and mushroom biomes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Mushroom Stew, Fermented Spider Eye, Rabbit Stew

red-mushroom.description: The red mushroom in Minecraft is used to create mushroom stew, fermented spider eyes and rabbit stew. It can be found in swamp and mushroom biomes.

block-of-gold.description: The gold block in Minecraft can be used as a way to save space (it holds 9 golden ingots), or as a way to show off your wealth. It can be made by placing a golden ingot in each square of the crafting table.

block-of-iron.description: The iron block in Minecraft can be used as a way to save space (it holds 9 iron ingots), or as a way to show off your wealth. It can be made by placing an iron ingot in each square of the crafting table.

oak-slab.description: An oak slab block can be crafted by placing 3 wooden planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

spruce-slab.description: A spruce slab block can be crafted by placing 3 spruce planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

birch-slab.description: A birch slab block can be crafted by placing 3 birch planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

jungle-slab.description: A jungle slab block can be crafted by placing 3 jungle planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

acacia-slab.description: An acacia slab block can be crafted by placing 3 acacia planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

dark-oak-slab.description: A dark oak slab block can be crafted by placing 3 dark oak planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

stone-slab.description: Wooden slabs are crafted by placing 3 wooden planks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

sandstone-slab.description: Sandstone slabs are crafted by placing 3 sandstone blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

petrified-oak-slab.description: This is a regular oak slab that is non-flammable. This item was removed when slabs were updated to become flammable in 1.3.1 (replaced with a flammable version of this item), it was reintroduced as the petrified oak slab in Minecraft 1.13.

cobblestone-slab.description: Cobblestone slabs are crafted by placing 3 cobblestone blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

brick-slab.description: Brick slabs are crafted by placing 3 bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

stone-brick-slab.description: Stonebrick slabs are crafted by placing 3 stone bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

nether-brick-slab.description: Netherbrick slabs are crafted by placing 3 nether bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

quartz-slab.description: Quartz slabs are crafted by placing 3 quartz blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

red-sandstone-slab.description: Red sandstone slabs are crafted by placing 3 red sandstone blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

purpur-slab.description: Purpur slabs are crafted by placing 3 purpur blocks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

prismarine-slab.description: This block has all of the same properties as a prismarine block, but is half its height. It was introduced in 1.13 and can be crafted by placing 3 prismarine blocks next to each other (3x1) in a crafting table.

prismarine-brick-slab.description: This block has all of the same properties as prismarine bricks, but is half its height. It was introduced in 1.13 and can be crafted by placing 3 prismarine brick (blocks) next to each other (3x1) in a crafting table.

dark-prismarine-slab.description: This block has all of the same properties as a dark prismarine block, but is half its height. It was introduced in 1.13 and can be crafted by placing 3 dark prismarine blocks next to each other (3x1) in a crafting table.

smooth-quartz.description: Double quartz slabs are created when two quartz slabs are placed on top of eachother. They cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft (although can be created as a block in the world).

properties.Recipes Used In: Smooth Quartz Stairs, Smooth Quartz Slab

smooth-red-sandstone.description: Smooth red sandstone is a decorative block that can be made using normal red sandstone.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smooth Red Sandstone Stairs, Smooth Red Sandstone Slab

smooth-sandstone.description: Smooth red sandstone is a decorative block that can be made using normal red sandstone.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smooth Sandstone Stairs, Smooth Sandstone Slab

smooth-stone.description: The smooth double stone slab, with no edges cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft, or spawned into your inventory. It is a decorative item that must be spawned using WorldEdit. The image pictured below is incorrect (this item is the smooth stone slab so there is no line in between the two slabs).

bricks.description: The brick block can be crafted in Minecraft by placing 4 bricks in the crafting table. It is used primarily as a decorative block, and can be used to make banners.

properties.Recipes Used In: Brick Slab, Brick Stairs, Brick Wall

tnt.description: TNT can be crafted by placing sand and gunpowder in the crafting table. The gunpowder should be in the middle and each corner, with sand in the empty slots. When ignited with flint and steel, or a fire arrow, it explodes and does damage to surrounding blocks.

bookshelf.description: Bookshelves can be crafted by placing 3 books in the vertical middle slots of the crafting table, and wooden blocks of any colour in the remaining 6 slots. When placed around enchantment tables, they increase the maximum level of enchantment the table can provide. They can also be used as a fuel in furnaces, although this isn't recommended as it isn't the most efficient fuel.. unless you hate libraries!

mossy-cobblestone.description: Moss stone is only dropped when the block is mined with a pickaxe. It can be crafted by placing a vine and a cobblestone block into the crafting table.

properties.Recipes Used In: Mossy Cobblestone Wall, Mossy Cobblestone Stairs, Mossy Cobblestone Slab

obsidian.description: Obsidian is created when water meets lava. It is one of the only blocks that will withstand an explosion in Minecraft. It cannot be crafted and must be mined with a diamond pickaxe.

torch.description: Torches in Minecraft are a primary light source. They can be crafted by placing a stick and a piece of coal on top in the crafting table.

end-rod.description: The end rod is a decorative Minecraft item that can be used as a light source, it also emits white particles around it. It can be made using a blaze rod and popped chorus fruit.

chorus-plant.description: The chorus plant block can only be found in the end, specifically on the outer islands. It is used to grow popped chorus fruit, which is an essential ingredient for crafting recipes for items such as the end rod.

chorus-flower.description: The chorus flower is a flower/fruit that grows on the chorus plant, which can be found in the end. Unlike regular Minecraft flowers, they must be planted on end stone, not dirt.

purpur-block.description: The purpur block in Minecraft is a solely decorative item that can be found in the end world. They must be mined with a pickaxe. They can also be crafted using popped chorus fruit.

purpur-pillar.description: The purpur pillar is a decorative variant of the purpur block. It can be made using two purpur slabs.

purpur-stairs.description: Purpur stairs can be made by placing 6 purpur blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

spawner.description: Mob spawners, or monster spawners, are blocks that spawn mobs when placed. Conditions (e.g. light levels) relative to the mob type of the spawner must still be met in order for the monster to spawn. They are often used in grinders, and can be found in dungeons but cannot be mined in Vanilla Minecraft.

oak-stairs.description: Oak wood stairs can be made by placing 6 oak wooden planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

chest.description: Chests in Minecraft are used to store items. To craft a chest, place one wooden plank in every outer square of the crafting table, leaving the middle empty. To open a chest, right click the chest block. When broken, the contents of a chest will be dropped on the floor. A chest has 27 slots, this can be increased to 54 by making placing a second chest next to the chest block, which forms a double chest.

properties.Recipes Used In: Trapped Chest, Hopper, Shulker Box, Minecart with Chest

diamond-ore.description: Diamond ore generates below Y 16 in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken with an iron or diamond pickaxe, a single diamond item is dropped. If broken with a silk touch enchanted pickaxe, the diamond ore block will be dropped.

block-of-diamond.description: Diamond blocks are crafted by placing 9 diamond items inside the crafting table (one in each square). They can be used to power beacons, or as a way to save chest space.

crafting-table.description: Crafting tables are one of the most important items in Minecraft. They are used for most crafting recipes as the inventory crafting square is only 2x2. To make a crafting bench, place 4 wooden planks in a 2x2 formation in a crafting square.

farmland.description: The hoed dirt/soil/grass block, otherwise known as 'farmland', cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. The block is formed when grass or dirt is right clicked with a hoe.

furnace.description: The burning furnace is a block that cannot be added to your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. The block is formed when fuel and an item to smelt are placed together in a regular furnace, and will drop a regular furnace item along with the contents of the furnace if broken.

properties.Recipes Used In: Minecart with Furnace, Smoker, Blast Furnace

ladder.description: The ladder item can be used to create ladders in Minecraft. Simply right click the ladder on the outer face of a block to place it. When you walk into a ladder block, you move upwards. If you stop walking forwards, whilst in the same square as a ladder block, you will move down the ladder. You do not take fall damage when you reach the bottom of a ladder.

rail.description: A rail is an item that can carry minecarts. It can be crafted with iron ingots and wooden planks. In can also be found in mineshafts, which are structures that generate naturally in Minecraft.

cobblestone-stairs.description: Cobblestone stairs can be made by placing 6 cobblestone blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

lever.description: A lever can be crafted with a stone block and wooden stick. When right clicked, it will switch upwards or downwards (relative to whether it is currently switched upwards or downwards). It is useful for redstone circuits, and can be used to activate things like iron doors.

stone-pressure-plate.description: The stone pressure plate can be crafted by placing two stone blocks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of. This block must be placed on top of a block, and will break if the block below it is broken.

oak-pressure-plate.description: The wooden pressure plate can be crafted by placing two wooden planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of. This block must be placed on top of a block, and will break if the block below it is broken.

spruce-pressure-plate.description: The spruce pressure plate can be crafted by placing two spruce planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

birch-pressure-plate.description: The birch pressure plate can be crafted by placing birch wooden planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

jungle-pressure-plate.description: The jungle pressure plate can be crafted by placing two jungle planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

acacia-pressure-plate.description: The acacia pressure plate can be crafted by placing two acacia planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

dark-oak-pressure-plate.description: The dark oak pressure plate can be crafted by placing two dark oak planks next to eachother in the crafting bench. It will activate any connected redstone wires, and any redstone wires below the block it is placed on top of.

redstone-ore.description: Glowing redstone ore is the block used to create the 'glowing effect' redstone ore sometimes has. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft.

redstone-torch.description: This is the block that takes the place of a redstone torch when it is switched on.

properties.Recipes Used In: Activator Rail, Redstone Repeater, Redstone Comparator

stone-button.description: The stone button is similar to the lever, in the sense that it can be used to activate/deactivate a redstone circuit. It is different because it will only 'activate' for 1 second after being pushed.

snow.description: The snow block in Minecraft spawns in ice plains, ice spikes, cold taiga, frozen river and cold beach biomes.

ice.description: Ice spawns and spreads in cold environments in Minecraft. When broken with an item that has the silk touch enchantment, an ice block is dropped. When broken with any other item, nothing is dropped and the block turns into water.

snow-block.description: The snow block in Minecraft spawns in ice plains, ice spikes, cold taiga, frozen river and cold beach biomes. If broken with a shovel that has the silk touch enchantment, the block is dropped. If broken with any regular shovel, snowballs are dropped. If broken with an item that isn't a shovel, nothing is dropped.

cactus.description: In Minecraft, when a mob or player walks into a cactus, they take half a heart of damage every second. When broken, the cactus drops itself on the floor. If the 'base' cactus of a cactus that is taller than one block is broken, all cacti blocks above are also broken.

clay.description: A random quantity of the clay item is dropped when a clay block is broken (found underwater in rivers and oceans). Clay can be used to make bricks and clay blocks.

jukebox.description: The jukebox is the block and item that is used to play music discs in Minecraft.

oak-fence.description: Fences in Minecraft are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft an oak fence, place 4 oak planks and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

spruce-fence.description: Spruce fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

birch-fence.description: Birch fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

jungle-fence.description: Jungle fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

acacia-fence.description: Acacia fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

dark-oak-fence.description: Dark oak fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table.

pumpkin.description: Pumpkins are the block that grow from pumpkin seeds in Minecraft. They cannot be crafted, but yield 4 pumpkin seeds when placed into the crafting table. As of 1.13, this item does not have a face carved into it. The new carved pumpkin block does, however.

carved-pumpkin.description: The carved pumpkin is the same as a regular pumpkin, but has the 'carved face' texture from versions before 1.13. It can be made by clicking on a regular pumpkin with shears.

netherrack.description: Netherrack cannot be crafted in Vanilla Minecraft. It is the primarily building block of the nether. It can be broken very fast with a pickaxe. When broken, it drops the netherrack item.

soul-sand.description: Your speed is reduced when walking over a soul sand block. The block can be used to create one-way doors in Minecraft. Soul sand cannot be crafted, but generates naturally in the nether.

glowstone.description: Glowstone is one of the brightest and strongest light sources in Minecraft. It emits light at a level of 15. When broken without a silk touch pickaxe, it drops 2-4 glowstone dust. It can be crafted by placing glowstone dust in the crafting table in a 2x2 formation.

oak-trapdoor.description: Trapdoors in Minecraft act like vertical doors (they open upwards). They are only 1 block in size. They are very useful for redstone contraptions.

spruce-trapdoor.description: The spruce trapdoor can be crafted using 6 spruce planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

birch-trapdoor.description: The birch trapdoor can be crafted using 6 birch planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

jungle-trapdoor.description: The jungle trapdoor can be crafted using 6 jungle planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

acacia-trapdoor.description: The acacia trapdoor can be crafted using 6 acacia planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

dark-oak-trapdoor.description: The dark oak trapdoor can be crafted using 6 dark oak planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

infested-stone.description: The stone monster egg block has the exact same properties as the stone block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

infested-cobblestone.description: The cobblestone monster egg block has the exact same properties as the cobblestone block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

infested-stone-bricks.description: The stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

infested-mossy-stone-bricks.description: The mossy stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the mossy stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

infested-cracked-stone-bricks.description: The cracked stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the cracked stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

infested-chiseled-stone-bricks.description: The chiseled stone brick monster egg block has the exact same properties as the chiseled stone brick block. When a monster egg block is broken, a silverfish mob is spawned and the original non-monster-egg block is dropped.

stone-bricks.description: Stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

properties.Recipes Used In: Stone Brick Slab, Mossy Stone Bricks, Stone Brick Stairs, Stone Brick Wall

mossy-stone-bricks.description: Mossy stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

properties.Recipes Used In: Mossy Stone Brick Wall, Mossy Stone Brick Stairs, Mossy Stone Brick Slab

cracked-stone-bricks.description: Cracked stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

chiseled-stone-bricks.description: Chiseled stone bricks in Minecraft are solely decorative blocks as they have no useful function in Vanilla Minecraft.

brown-mushroom-block.description: The brown mushroom block is a constituent of trees found in mushroom biomes. When broken, it sometimes drops mushrooms. The block itself will only be dropped when broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment.

red-mushroom-block.description: The red mushroom block is a constituent of trees found in mushroom biomes. When broken, it sometimes drops mushrooms. The block itself will only be dropped when broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment.

mushroom-stem.description: The mushroom stem is the block that makes up the 'logs' of the mushroom tree in Minecraft. It was added in Minecraft 1.13 as an obtainable item.

iron-bars.description: Iron bars, also known as iron fences, do not act like regular fences as they can be jumped over. To craft 16 iron bars, place an iron ingot in the 2 bottom rows of the crafting table (6 total iron ingots).

glass-pane.description: The glass pane is similar to the glass block, in the sense that it is transparent. Glass panes can be crafted by placing a glass block in each of the 2 bottom rows of the crafting table (6 total glass).

properties.Recipes Used In: White Stained Glass Pane, Orange Stained Glass Pane, Magenta Stained Glass Pane, Light Blue Stained Glass Pane, Yellow Stained Glass Pane, Lime Stained Glass Pane, Pink Stained Glass Pane, Gray Stained Glass Pane, Light Gray Stained Glass Pane, Cyan Stained Glass Pane, Purple Stained Glass Pane, Blue Stained Glass Pane, Brown Stained Glass Pane, Green Stained Glass Pane, Red Stained Glass Pane, Black Stained Glass Pane

melon.description: The melon block is the block that is formed when a melon plant finished growing. When broken, it will drop 3-7 sliced melons. To obtain the melon block (not the slices), the block must be broken with a silk touch enchanted item.

vines.description: Vines have the same mechanics as ladders. They can only be placed on one of the 4 outer faces of a block. They are an essential crafting ingedient for mossy cobblestone and mossy stone bricks.

oak-fence-gate.description: Oak fence gates are 1 block in size (they cannot be jumped over) and act exactly like doors. They can be attached to fences and activated by redstone. They are useful to stop mobs from escaping mob farms.

spruce-fence-gate.description: Spruce fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

birch-fence-gate.description: Birch fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

jungle-fence-gate.description: Jungle fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

acacia-fence-gate.description: Acacia fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

dark-oak-fence-gate.description: Dark oak fence gates in Minecraft can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

brick-stairs.description: Brick stairs are a decorative block in Minecraft. They can be made using 6 brick blocks.

stone-brick-stairs.description: Stone brick stairs are a decorative block in Minecraft. They can be made using 6 stone brick blocks.

mycelium.description: Mycelium is a block that can be found in mushroom biomes, and can only be obtained when broken with a tool that has the silk touch enchantment. When placed near grass blocks, it may spread to them. It is useful for growing mushrooms.

lily-pad.description: Lily pads are item in Minecraft that can be placed on top of water. They are useful as they can act as stepping stones that do not take up much room. They cannot be crafted, but naturally generate on water in biomes.

nether-bricks.description: Nether brick blocks can be found inside nether fortresses. They can also be crafted using, you guessed it.. nether bricks! The block is immune to the ghast fireball.

properties.Recipes Used In: Nether Brick Slab, Nether Brick Fence, Nether Brick Stairs, Nether Brick Wall

nether-brick-fence.description: Nether brick fences in Minecraft are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft a netherbrick fence, place 6 nether brick blocks in the crafting table.

nether-brick-stairs.description: The nether wart block is the block that takes the place of nether wart when it is right clicked on the ground. It can only be placed on soul sand. When broken, it drops the nether wart item.

enchanting-table.description: The enchanting table in Minecraft is a very useful item. It is used to enchant items, tools and armour with enchantments such as the silk touch and sharpness enchantment. The crafting recipe consists of 2 diamonds, 4 obsidian blocks and 1 book.

end-portal-frame.description: The end portal frame in Minecraft cannot be crafted. They are indestructible in the survival and adventure gamemodes. They generate inside strongholds and are used as a gateway to the end in Minecraft. They emit a light level of 1 and can be used as a component of redstone circuits.

end-stone.description: End stone is the main building block in the end. It can be broken almost instantly with a pickaxe. The item itself can only be found (in plentiful quantities) in the end, it cannot be crafted. It can be used to craft end stone bricks.

end-stone-bricks.description: End stone bricks are a decorative variant of end stone. They can be made by placing 4 endstone in a 2x2 formation in the crafting table.

properties.Recipes Used In: End Stone Brick Wall, End Stone Brick Stairs, End Stone Brick Slab

dragon-egg.description: The dragon egg in Minecraft can be found in the end. It is dropped when the ender dragon is defeated and cannot be mined if there are free air blocks around it for it to move to.

redstone-lamp.description: This is the block that takes the place of a redstone lamp when it is switched on.

sandstone-stairs.description: Sandstone stairs can be made by placing 6 sandstone blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

emerald-ore.description: Emerald ore, when broken with a pickaxe, drops the emerald item. To obtain the emerald ore block, the block must be mined with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. The block itself only generates naturally in Minecraft inside the extreme hills biome.

ender-chest.description: Enderchests are very useful items in Minecraft. They act as universal chests - the contents of the chest are player specific, and will be the same (relative to the player), regardless of what enderchest is being opened. It has 27 slots.

tripwire-hook.description: Tripwire hooks in Minecraft are used to create tripwires, which can be used in redstone circuits to detect entities.

block-of-emerald.description: The emerald block, also known as a block of emerald, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing an emerald in each square of the crafting table. It can be used in beacons are as a way to store emeralds more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 emeralds again by placing it in a crafting table).

spruce-stairs.description: Spruce wood stairs can be made by placing 6 spruce wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

birch-stairs.description: Birch wood stairs can be made by placing 6 birch wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

jungle-stairs.description: Jungle wood stairs can be made by placing 6 jungle wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

command-block.description: The command block in Minecraft can be used to execute commands. They cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC but, by using the item id, you can spawn the command block item into your inventory when in creative mode. In many cases, you must be a server op to use the block. Modifiers such as @p and @e can be used to target things like players and entities with commands.

beacon.description: The beacon block in Minecraft can be used to give nearby players potion effects. Blocks under the beacon in a 'pyramid' formation can be used to give the beacon more power and/or distance. It also emits light at a level of 15 (the highest possible level for a light source).

cobblestone-wall.description: Cobblestone walls act like fences (they cannot be jumped over). They have a higher durability and will not be dropped if they are mined without a pickaxe.

mossy-cobblestone-wall.description: Mossy cobblestone walls act like fences (they cannot be jumped over). They have a higher durability and will not be dropped if they are mined without a pickaxe.

oak-button.description: The wooden button is similar to the lever, in the sense that it can be used to activate/deactivate a redstone circuit. It is different because it will only 'activate' for 1 second after being pushed.

spruce-button.description: A spruce button can be crafted by placing 1 spruce plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

birch-button.description: A birch button can be crafted by placing 1 birch plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

jungle-button.description: A jungle button can be crafted by placing 1 jungle plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

acacia-button.description: An acacia button can be crafted by placing 1 acacia plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

dark-oak-button.description: A dark oak button can be crafted by placing 1 dark oak plank in a crafting table. It can be used to activate a redstone circuit.

anvil.description: Anvils are very useful items in Minecraft. They can be used to repair items and merge enchantments. They require exp and a lot of iron to make. With use, the durability of this item/block decreases and it will eventually break if not repaired.

chipped-anvil.description: This is the block that takes the place of a slightly damaged anvil in Minecraft.

damaged-anvil.description: This is the block that takes the place of a severely damaged anvil in Minecraft.

trapped-chest.description: The trapped chest item produces redstone power when it is opened. For this reason, it is very useful in redstone circuits.

light-weighted-pressure-plate.description: Weighted pressure plates useful items in redstone circuits. They act just like normal wooden and stone pressure plates, but activate based on the amount of weight placed on them. This means they may not activate when an item is placed on them.

heavy-weighted-pressure-plate.description: Weighted pressure plates useful items in redstone circuits. They act just like normal wooden and stone pressure plates, but activate based on the amount of weight placed on them. This means they may not activate when an item is placed on them.

daylight-detector.description: Inverted daylight sensors act in a similar way to regular daylight sensors, they simply provide a current when it is dark, rather than when it is light.

block-of-redstone.description: The redstone block, also known as a block of redstone, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing redstone dust in each square of the crafting table. It is used in redstone circuits as it has special functions, and does not act like redstone dust. It can also be used to store redstone more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 redstone again by placing it in a crafting table).

nether-quartz-ore.description: Nether quartz ore is found between Y 7 and Y 117 in the nether region in Minecraft. When broken with any pickaxe, it drops the nether quartz item.

hopper.description: Hoppers are very useful items as they can pick up items dropped above them and transfer them to chests. Hoppers are often used in redstone circuits and/or mob farms/grinders.

chiseled-quartz-block.description: The chiseled quartz block is almost exactly the same as the quartz block. The only difference is the texture.

block-of-quartz.description: The nether quartz block, also known as a block of quartz, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing a quartz in each square of the crafting table. It can be used as a way to store quartz more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 quartz again by placing it in a crafting table).

properties.Recipes Used In: Quartz Slab, Quartz Pillar, Quartz Stairs, Quartz Bricks

quartz-pillar.description: The pillar quartz block is almost exactly the same as the quartz block. The only difference is the texture.

quartz-stairs.description: Quartz stairs can be made by placing 5 quartz blocks, and 1 chiseled quartz block, in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

activator-rail.description: Activator rails do as the name would suggest - they activate when a minecart passes over them. They are useful for detecting minecarts in redstone circuits.

dropper.description: Droppers in Minecraft are used as a redstone component to move items, and also deposit them into containers such as chests.

barrier.description: The Minecraft barrier block, otherwise known as invisible bedrock, is an unbreakable invisible block added in Minecraft 1.8. It can only be broken by players in the creative gamemode and is very useful for adventure maps and builders as it prevents players from jumping past it.

iron-trapdoor.description: Iron trap doors act like vertical doors, and take up one block. They can only be opened using buttons and levers.

hay-bale.description: A hay bale can be mined with any tool, or your hand and can be crafted by placing wheat in each square (9) of a crafting bench. They can be fed to animals such as horses in Minecraft.

white-carpet.description: White carpet is a decorative block in Minecraft. It can be crafted using two wool blocks, and can be coloured using dyes. There are a few obscure uses for carpets, such as being a thin block, having an invisible hit box and being a transparent block that doesn't decrease light travelling through it.

terracotta.description: Hardened clay, also known as terracotta in Minecraft, can be made by smelting clay in a furnace (with fuel). It can be dyed, and also can be used as a crafting and smelting ingredient to make more decorative blocks.

block-of-coal.description: The coal block, also known as a block of coal, in Minecraft can be crafted by placing an coal item in each square of the crafting table. It can be used as a way to store coal more efficiently (as it can be exchanged for exactly 9 coal items again by placing it in a crafting table).

packed-ice.description: Packed ice is similar to regular Minecraft ice, it can be found in the ice plains spikes biome, which is hard to come across. The block can only be obtained when it is broken with a silk touch enchanted pickaxe.

acacia-stairs.description: Acacia wood stairs can be made by placing 6 acacia wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

dark-oak-stairs.description: Dark oak wood stairs can be made by placing 6 acacia wood planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

slime-block.description: The slime block in Minecraft can be crafted using 9 slime balls. When an entity jumps/lands on a slime block, they 'bounce' and as a result, their jump height is increased. Slime blocks can also be used as an efficient way to store slime, as they hold 9 slime balls.

grass-path.description: Grass paths are retextured grass blocks that can be used as 'paths' due to their darker colour.

sunflower.description: The sunflower block in Minecraft is a two block tall flower, it can be used to make dyes and also as a decorative item. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals.

lilac.description: The lilac block in Minecraft is a two block tall flower, it can be used to make dyes and also as a decorative item. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals.

rose-bush.description: The rose bush in Minecraft is a two block tall flower, it can be used to make dyes and also as a decorative item. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals.

peony.description: The peony block in Minecraft is a two block tall flower, it can be used to make dyes and also as a decorative item. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals.

tall-grass.description: The double tallgrass block in Minecraft is a two block tall block of grass, it can be used to make dyes and also as a decorative item. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals.

large-fern.description: The large fern block in Minecraft is a two block tall fern block, it can be used to make dyes and also as a decorative item. Dyes can be used to change the colour of lots of different items, ranging from fireworks to animals.

prismarine.description: Prismarine is a block that can only be found in ocean monuments in Minecraft. The block itself acts just like stone, but has a higher blast resistance.

properties.Recipes Used In: Prismarine Slab, Prismarine Stairs, Prismarine Wall

prismarine-bricks.description: Prismarine bricks, like the prismarine block, have a high blast resistance. They can be found underwater in Minecraft ocean monuments.

properties.Recipes Used In: Prismarine Brick Slab, Prismarine Brick Stairs

dark-prismarine.description: Dark prismarine is made with 8 prismarine shards and an ink sac. It is a darker, decorative version of the prismarine block.

properties.Recipes Used In: Dark Prismarine Slab, Dark Prismarine Stairs

prismarine-stairs.description: Prismarine stairs can be crafted by placing 6 prismarine blocks in the crafting table. This item was introduced in Minecraft 1.13.

prismarine-brick-stairs.description: Prismarine brick stairs can be crafted by placing 6 prismarine bricks (blocks) in the crafting table. This item was introduced in Minecraft 1.13.

dark-prismarine-stairs.description: Dark prismarine stairs can be crafted by placing 6 dark prismarine blocks in the crafting table. This item was introduced in Minecraft 1.13.

sea-lantern.description: The sea lantern can be found in ocean monuments. It is a light source that emits a light level of 15, similar to glowstone.

red-sandstone.description: Red sandstone is a solid block in Minecraft that has the same properties of regular sandstone, it can be crafted using red sand which can only be found in select biomes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Red Sandstone Slab, Cut Red Sandstone, Red Sandstone Stairs, Red Sandstone Wall

chiseled-red-sandstone.description: Chiseled red sandstone is a decorative variant of the red sandstone block. It can be made by placing two red sandstone slabs on top of eachother in the crafting table.

properties.Recipes Used In: Red Sandstone Slab, Red Sandstone Stairs

cut-red-sandstone.description: Smooth red sandstone is a decorative variant of the red sandstone block. To craft this item, place 4 red sandstone blocks in a 2x2 formation in the crafting table (yields 4 blocks).

properties.Recipes Used In: Red Sandstone Stairs, Cut Red Sandstone Slab

red-sandstone-stairs.description: Red sandstone stairs can be made by placing 6 red sandstone blocks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

repeating-command-block.description: The repeating command block acts like a regular command block, but will also repeat its command every tick until no longer activated.

chain-command-block.description: The chain command block acts like a regular command block, but will not execute its command until the command block it is facing has been activated first.

magma-block.description: The magma block can be found in the nether. They spawn naturally. When stepped on, they cause fire damage.

nether-wart-block.description: The nether wart block can be made by placing a nether wart item in each square of the crafting table in Minecraft. It can be used as a way to efficiently store nether wart, or as a decorative item.

red-nether-bricks.description: Red netherbrick has all the same properties of netherbrick, like good blast resistance, but is colored red. It is a decorative variant of the nether brick block.

properties.Recipes Used In: Red Nether Brick Wall, Red Nether Brick Stairs, Red Nether Brick Slab

bone-block.description: The bone block can be made by placing a bone item in each square of the crafting table in Minecraft. It can be used as a way to efficiently store bones, or as a decorative item.

structure-void.description: Structure voids in Minecraft are useful blocks, especially for redstone circuits and map creation. Structure blocks will not override any blocks they are saved into.

observer.description: Observer blocks are used in redstone circuits. They fire a redstone signal when an adjoining block is updated.

shulker-box.description: Shulker boxes are used to store items. When broken, they do not drop their contents - meaning they can be obtained when the block is placed again. They can be colored using dyes.

white-concrete-powder.description: Concrete powder is made using sand. It is the ingredient that must be mixed with water to create concrete. There are 16 different color variations, which can be achieved with dyes.

orange-concrete-powder.description: Concrete powder is made using sand. It is the ingredient that must be mixed with water to create concrete. There are 16 different color variations, which can be achieved with dyes.
