turtle-egg.description: This egg will hatch into a baby turtle (only at night) after going through all stages of growth/development. It can be obtained if broken with a silk touch pickaxe.

dead-tube-coral-block.description: This block is obtained when a tube coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

dead-brain-coral-block.description: This block is obtained when a brain coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

dead-bubble-coral-block.description: This block is obtained when a bubble coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

dead-fire-coral-block.description: This block is obtained when a fire coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

dead-horn-coral-block.description: This block is obtained when a horn coral block is broken with a pickaxe that does not have the silk touch enchantment.

tube-coral-block.description: The tube coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

brain-coral-block.description: The brain coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

bubble-coral-block.description: The bubble coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

fire-coral-block.description: The fire coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

horn-coral-block.description: The horn coral block generates naturally - as of 1.13, it cannot be crafted. It can only be obtained as an item if broken with a pickaxe that has the silk touch enchantment. Coral blocks are currently decorative items that have no specific/other uses.

tube-coral.description: Tube coral is a blue colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

brain-coral.description: Brain coral is a pink colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

bubble-coral.description: Bubble coral is a purple colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

fire-coral.description: Fire coral is a red colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

horn-coral.description: Horn coral is a yellow colored decorative item that grows underwater, it is similar to a shrub and will always drop itself when broken.

tube-coral-fan.description: Tube coral fans have similar properties to tube coral - they are blue, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

brain-coral-fan.description: Brain coral fans have similar properties to brain coral - they are pink, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

bubble-coral-fan.description: Bubble coral fans have similar properties to bubble coral - they are purple, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

fire-coral-fan.description: Fire coral fans have similar properties to fire coral - they are red, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

horn-coral-fan.description: Horn coral fans have similar properties to horn coral - they are yellow, drop themselves when broken and grow underwater. However, have a slightly different model and can be placed on the side and bottom of blocks.

blue-ice.description: Blue ice is an item similar to packed ice - it can be crafted by placing a packed ice block in each square of the crafting table. It will not melt near light sources and allows for faster sliding of items, boats, water currents, etc.

conduit.description: This item can be crafted with 8 nautilus shells and 1 heart of the sea. It will give players the conduit power status effect.

iron-door.description: The iron door item can be made with iron ingots. When placed, the door can only be opened with buttons/levers, and not by right clicking.

oak-door.description: When placed, this item becomes the door block, which can be open/closed to stop mobs, etc from entering an area. To open/close a door, simply right click it.

spruce-door.description: Dark oak doors in Minecraft can be both opened and closed. They are two blocks in height. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

birch-door.description: Birch doors in Minecraft can be both opened and closed. They are two blocks in height. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

jungle-door.description: The jungle door block is created when an jungle door item is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops the door item.

acacia-door.description: The acacia door block is created when an acacia door item is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops the door item.

dark-oak-door.description: The dark oak door block is created when an dark oak door item is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops the door item.

redstone-repeater.description: Redstone repeaters can be used to delay a redstone signal, useful for creating repeating circuits and complex redstone circuits in Minecraft.

redstone-comparator.description: A redstone comparator can be used to change the strength of a redstone signal. It can also be used to measure things like container fullness and compare signal strengths.

structure-block.description: Structure blocks are a non-Vanilla Minecraft item that can be used to generate structures.

turtle-shell.description: This item can be crafted by placing 5 scutes in a crafting table (in a helmet shape). It will give the wielder the water breathing potion effect when worn underwater.

scute.description: Scutes are dropped by baby turtles when they grow into adults. They are used to craft turtle shell helmets.

iron-shovel.description: Iron shovels require 1 iron ingot to craft. They can break dirt, sand, gravel and other similar blocks at a faster rate than lower-level shovels.

iron-pickaxe.description: Iron pickaxes require 3 iron ingots to craft. They are required to mine diamonds, and mine other blocks like stone, cobblestone, and ores at a faster rate than lower-level pickaxes.

iron-axe.description: Iron axes (hatchet) are used to cut wooden items like planks, logs, slabs, etc rate at a faster rate. They require 3 iron ingots to craft.

flint-and-steel.description: Flint and steel can be made with flint and iron. The item is used to create fire in Minecraft, by right clicking a block.

apple.description: Apples can be eaten, or used to create golden apples and notch/god apples. Apples have a 1 in 200 chance of being dropped when leaves decay, or are broken.

bow.description: Bows are used to shoot arrows in Minecraft. When the arrow hits an entity, it causes damage. They are also required to make dispensers.

arrow.description: Arrows are used as ammunition for bows. They can also be used in dispensers. When they collide with a damageable mob/entity, they cause damage. They can also activate things like pressure plates.

coal.description: Coal is obtained when coal ore is mined in Minecraft. Coal can be used to create coal blocks, or as a fuel in a furnace to smelt items.

properties.Recipes Used In: Torch, Block of Coal, Fire Charge, Campfire, Soul Torch

charcoal.description: Charcoal in Minecraft is used as a fuel, just like regular coal. It could be considered superior can be made with logs, so you do not need to mine coal to use it as a fuel.

properties.Recipes Used In: Torch, Fire Charge, Campfire, Soul Torch

diamond.description: Diamonds are perhaps Minecraft's most famous item. They can be used to make diamond armour, weapons and tools - as well as blocks like enchantment tables. They are obtained when diamond ore is mined.

properties.Recipes Used In: Block of Diamond, Jukebox, Enchanting Table, Diamond Sword, Diamond Shovel, Diamond Pickaxe, Diamond Axe, Diamond Hoe, Diamond Helmet, Diamond Chestplate, Diamond Leggings, Diamond Boots

iron-ingot.description: Iron ingots are obtained when iron ore is smelted with fuel in a furnace. Iron ingots are an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes including iron tools, weapons and armour - along with things like iron doors and anvils.

properties.Recipes Used In: Detector Rail, Piston, Block of Iron, Rail, Iron Bars, Tripwire Hook, Anvil, Heavy Weighted Pressure Plate, Hopper, Activator Rail, Iron Trapdoor, Iron Door, Iron Shovel, Iron Pickaxe, Iron Axe, Flint and Steel, Iron Sword, Iron Hoe, Iron Helmet, Iron Chestplate, Iron Leggings, Iron Boots, Bucket, Minecart, Compass, Shears, Cauldron, Shield, Iron Nugget, Crossbow, Blast Furnace, Smithing Table, Stonecutter, Chain

gold-ingot.description: Golden ingots are obtained when gold ore is smelted with fuel in a furnace. They can be converted into golden nuggets, or used to create golden armour, tools and weapons. Golden ingots can also be used to make golden apples and are used in other crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Powered Rail, Block of Gold, Light Weighted Pressure Plate, Golden Sword, Golden Shovel, Golden Pickaxe, Golden Axe, Golden Hoe, Golden Helmet, Golden Chestplate, Golden Leggings, Golden Boots, Golden Apple, Clock, Gold Nugget, Netherite Ingot

iron-sword.description: Iron swords can be crafted using two iron ingots and a stick in Minecraft. They deal more damage to mobs and other entities than lower-leveled swords and weapons.

wooden-sword.description: Wood swords in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden planks and 1 wooden stick. They are the least powerful sword, but still deal more damage to mobs and entities than your bare hands would, and can be enchanted.

wooden-shovel.description: Wood shovels in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 wooden plank. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still break dirt, sand, gravel, etc faster than your bare hands.

wooden-pickaxe.description: Wood pickaxes in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 wooden planks. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still mine stone, cobblestone, etc faster than your bare hands.

wooden-axe.description: Wood axes (hatchet) in Minecraft can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 wooden planks. Whilst wooden tools are the weakest of all tools in Minecraft, this will still break wooden blocks and logs faster than your bare hands.

stone-sword.description: Stone swords are the 2nd least powerful swords in Minecraft. They are easy to make: 1 stick and 2 cobblestone is required and deal a considerable amount of damage to mobs and other entities.

stone-shovel.description: Stone shovels can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 cobblestone/stone block. Whilst stone tools are the 2nd weakest tool in Minecraft, they are a massive step up from wooden tools in both durability and the time they take to break blocks.

stone-pickaxe.description: Stone pickaxes can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 cobblestone/stone blocks. They are the lowest level of tool that can mine iron ore.

stone-axe.description: Stone axes (hatchet) can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 cobblestone/stone blocks. They can break wooden blocks much faster than wooden tools and your bare hands, but are still the 2nd weakest tool for breaking wood in Minecraft.

diamond-sword.description: Diamond swords are the most powerful weapon in Minecraft. They can be crafted using 2 diamonds and 1 wooden stick. They can also be enchanted and found in villages/dungeons.

diamond-shovel.description: Diamond shovels can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 1 diamond. They are the fastest tool for breaking dirt, sand, gravel, etc in Minecraft.

diamond-pickaxe.description: Diamond pickaxes are the only pickaxe that can break obsidian in Minecraft. They can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 diamonds. They are the fastest tool for mining stone, ores, etc in Minecraft.

diamond-axe.description: Diamond axes can be crafted using 2 wooden sticks and 3 diamonds in Minecraft. They are the fastest tool for breaking wood, logs and other wooden items in the game.

stick.description: Sticks can be made using 2 wooden planks. They are required for all crafting recipes involving tools and weapons.

properties.Recipes Used In: Powered Rail, Torch, Ladder, Rail, Lever, Redstone Torch, Oak Fence, Spruce Fence, Birch Fence, Jungle Fence, Acacia Fence, Dark Oak Fence, Oak Fence Gate, Spruce Fence Gate, Birch Fence Gate, Jungle Fence Gate, Acacia Fence Gate, Dark Oak Fence Gate, Tripwire Hook, Activator Rail, Iron Shovel, Iron Pickaxe, Iron Axe, Bow, Arrow, Iron Sword, Wooden Sword, Wooden Shovel, Wooden Pickaxe, Wooden Axe, Stone Sword, Stone Shovel, Stone Pickaxe, Stone Axe, Diamond Sword, Diamond Shovel, Diamond Pickaxe, Diamond Axe, Golden Sword, Golden Shovel, Golden Pickaxe, Golden Axe, Wooden Hoe, Stone Hoe, Iron Hoe, Diamond Hoe, Golden Hoe, Painting, Fishing Rod, Item Frame, Armor Stand, White Banner, Orange Banner, Magenta Banner, Light Blue Banner, Yellow Banner, Lime Banner, Pink Banner, Gray Banner, Light Gray Banner, Cyan Banner, Purple Banner, Blue Banner, Brown Banner, Green Banner, Red Banner, Black Banner, Oak Sign, Spruce Sign, Birch Sign, Jungle Sign, Acacia Sign, Dark Oak Sign, Crossbow, Grindstone, Campfire, Crimson Fence, Warped Fence, Soul Torch, Crimson Fence Gate, Warped Fence Gate, Crimson Sign, Warped Sign, Soul Campfire

bowl.description: Bowls can be crafted using 3 wooden planks in Minecraft. They are used in crafting recipes for item such as mushroom stew, rabbit stew and beetroot soup.

properties.Recipes Used In: Mushroom Stew, Rabbit Stew, Beetroot Soup

mushroom-stew.description: Mushroom stew in Minecraft can be made using 1 red mushroom, 1 brown mushroom and 1 bowl.

golden-sword.description: In Minecraft, golden swords can be made using 1 wooden stick and 2 golden ingots. They have a very low durability.

golden-shovel.description: Golden shovels can be made using 2 wooden sticks and 1 golden ingot. They are faster than wooden shovels, but have a very low durability.

golden-pickaxe.description: Golden pickaxes can be made using 2 wooden sticks and 3 golden ingots. They are faster than wooden pickaxes, but have a very low durability.

golden-axe.description: Golden axes (hatchet) can be made using 2 wooden sticks and 3 golden ingots. They are faster than wooden axes, but have a very low durability.

string.description: String in Minecraft can be made using wool. It is also dropped from spiders. It is essential for making many items such as bows.

properties.Recipes Used In: White Wool, Bow, Fishing Rod, Lead, Scaffolding, Crossbow, Loom

feather.description: Feathers can be used to make items such as arrows and books and quills. They are dropped by chickens and parrots.

gunpowder.description: Gun powder is used to make TNT in Minecraft. It is dropped by creepers when they are killed and do not explode.

wooden-hoe.description: Wood hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 wooden planks. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

stone-hoe.description: Stone hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 stone/cobblestone blocks. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

iron-hoe.description: Iron hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 iron ignots. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

diamond-hoe.description: Diamond hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 diamonds. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

golden-hoe.description: Golden hoes in Minecraft can be made with 2 sticks and 2 golden ingots. They are used to hoe land. Higher level hoes simply have higher durability.

wheat-seeds.description: Wheat seeds are the item that is used to plant wheat in Minecraft. They can be obtained from grass (when it is broken) and planted on hoed land by right click.

wheat.description: Wheat in Minecraft can be obtained from seeds, when they are fully grown. It is also found in dungeons and villagers. Wheat is used to make bread.

bread.description: Bread is a food (satiates hunger) that can be made with 3 pieces of wheat.

leather-cap.description: Leather helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level head armor in the game.

leather-tunic.description: Leather tunics in Minecraft can be made with 8 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level chestplate in the game.

leather-pants.description: Leather leggings in Minecraft can be made with 7 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level leg armor in the game.

leather-boots.description: Leather boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 pieces of leather. They are the lowest level foot armor in the game.

chainmail-helmet.description: Chainmail helmets can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

chainmail-chestplate.description: Chainmail chestplates can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

chainmail-leggings.description: Chainmail pants can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

chainmail-boots.description: Chainmail boots can be found in dungeons in Minecraft. Chainmail armor is slightly weaker than iron, and cannot be crafted.

iron-helmet.description: Iron helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

iron-chestplate.description: Iron chestplates in Minecraft can be made with 8 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

iron-leggings.description: Iron pants in Minecraft can be made with 7 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

iron-boots.description: Iron boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 iron ingots. They are the 2nd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

diamond-helmet.description: Diamond helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

diamond-chestplate.description: Diamond chestplates in Minecraft can be made with 8 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

diamond-leggings.description: Diamond pants in Minecraft can be made with 7 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

diamond-boots.description: Diamond boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 diamonds. They are the highest level pieces of armor in the game.

golden-helmet.description: Gold helmets in Minecraft can be made with 5 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

golden-chestplate.description: Gold chestplates in Minecraft can be made with 8 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

golden-leggings.description: Gold pants in Minecraft can be made with 7 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

golden-boots.description: Gold boots in Minecraft can be made with 4 golden ingots. They are the 3rd highest level pieces of armor in the game.

flint.description: Flint is dropped sometimes when gravel in broken in Minecraft. It is used to make flint and steel.

properties.Recipes Used In: Flint and Steel, Arrow, Fletching Table

raw-porkchop.description: Raw porkchop is dropped from pigs in Minecraft when they are killed (and not on fire). It can be cooked in a furnace to form cooked porkchop, which is a food item.

cooked-porkchop.description: Cooked porkchop can be made by killing a pig whilst it is on fire, or by cooking raw porkchop in a furnace. When eaten, this item satiates your hunger.

painting.description: Paintings are items in Minecraft that display a piece of artwork. The piece of art shown is random.

golden-apple.description: Golden apples in Minecraft provide absorption, 2 hunger levels and the regeneration potion effect when consumed. They can be made with 8 golden ingots and 1 apple.

enchanted-golden-apple.description: The enchanted golden apple, also known as the god apple, notch apple, or OP apple in Minecraft is an item that require 8 golden blocks and 1 apple to craft. It provides 30 seconds of regeneration, 2 minutes of absorption and 5 minutes of both resistance and fire resistance when consumed.

sign.description: Signs in Minecraft can have 4 lines of text written on them. Right click the sign on a wall, or the ground to place it.

bucket.description: A bucket is made with 3 iron ingots. It can be filled with water or lava by right clicking on a water or lava source.

water-bucket.description: A water bucket can be obtained by right clicking a bucket on a water source. Water buckets are useful for moving water.

lava-bucket.description: A lava bucket can be obtained by right clicking a bucket on a lava source. Lava buckets are useful for moving lava.

minecart.description: A minecart can be made using 5 iron ingots. It is primarily a transportation item that can be used to move quickly across mine tracks. It also can be used to make things like hopper minecarts, which are useful for redstone circuits.

properties.Recipes Used In: Minecart with Chest, Minecart with Furnace, Minecart with TNT, Minecart with Hopper

saddle.description: A saddle can be placed on a pig, horse, or any other rideable mob to.. ride it! This is useful as riding on mobs like horses is faster than sprinting!

redstone.description: Redstone dust is an essential item for redstone circuits. A random number of redstone is dropped when redstone ore is broken. Redstone is also used in many different crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Dispenser, Note Block, Powered Rail, Detector Rail, Piston, Redstone Torch, Redstone Lamp, Block of Redstone, Dropper, Observer, Redstone Repeater, Compass, Clock, Target

snowball.description: Snowballs are obtained when snow is broken with any shovel. They can be thrown by right clicking them.

oak-boat.description: Oak boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 oak planks, and put on water by right click.

leather.description: A random amount of leather is dropped when cows are killed. Leather can be used to create leather armor, and is an essential ingredient in many other crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Leather Cap, Leather Tunic, Leather Pants, Leather Boots, Book, Item Frame, Leather Horse Armor

milk-bucket.description: Buckets of milk can be obtained by right clicking a cow with an empty bucket. They are required to make cakes.

bucket-of-pufferfish.description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a pufferfish mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

bucket-of-salmon.description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a salmon mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

bucket-of-cod.description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a cod mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

bucket-of-tropical-fish.description: This item can be obtained by using any water bucket on a tropical fish mob (as of 1.13). You can then right click this item anywhere in the world to place the water in the bucket with the fish within - making it a useful item from transporting fish.

brick.description: Bricks in Minecraft can be made by smelting clay in a furnace. They are used to create flower pots and bricks (block).

sugar-cane.description: Sugar canes can be found alongside rivers. They can only be placed on sand. When placed near an adequate water source, and there is a high light level, sugar canes will grow.

kelp.description: Kelp is a plant that grows in the ocean. It can be put inside a furnace to create dried kelp, a consumable item.

dried-kelp-block.description: This item can be crafted by placing a dried kelp in each square of a crafting bench (9 total). It can be used as a fuel in a furnace.

paper.description: Paper can be made by placing 3 sugar cane in a vertical line in the crafting bench. It is used to create maps, books and fireworks.

properties.Recipes Used In: Book, Empty Map, Banner Pattern, Banner Pattern, Banner Pattern, Banner Pattern, Cartography Table

book.description: Books in Minecraft can be made with 3 paper and 1 piece of leather. They are required to make enchantment tables, bookshelves and the book and quill item.

properties.Recipes Used In: Bookshelf, Enchanting Table, Book and Quill

slimeball.description: Slimeballs in Minecraft are dropped when slimes are killed (0-2). They are used to create many items, such as magma cream and leads. They are also required to make sticky pistons, an important redstone component.

properties.Recipes Used In: Sticky Piston, Slime Block, Magma Cream, Lead

minecart-with-chest.description: Minecarts with chests are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with chests. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the chest interface to store items.

minecart-with-furnace.description: Minecarts with furnaces are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with furnaces inside. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the furnace interface to smelt and cook items.

egg.description: Eggs in Minecraft are dropped by chickens (naturally, not when killed). When right clicked, they are thrown like snowballs and have a 1 in 8 chance of spawning a baby chicken. Eggs are also used to create cakes and pumpkin pies in Minecraft.

compass.description: Unlike real-life compasses, Minecraft compasses point to the world spawn point. They are useful for navigation. In the nether and end, the item does not work.

fishing-rod.description: Fishing rods can be made with 3 sticks and 2 pieces of string. When right clicked, they will cast a line. They can be used to fish, but there is a rare chance of finding other items. Carrots can also be added to the end of fishing rods, which can be used to move pigs around.

properties.Recipes Used In: Carrot on a Stick, Warped Fungus on a Stick

clock.description: Clocks in Minecraft can be used to tell the time of day.. it'd probably be easier to just look outside!

glowstone-dust.description: Glowstone dust is dropped in random amounts when glowstone is broken. It is used as a brewing ingredient, and also in some crafting recipes such as the glowstone block.

raw-cod.description: Raw fish, also known as raw cod, in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

raw-salmon.description: Raw salmon in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

tropical-fish.description: Clownfish in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

pufferfish.description: Pufferfish in Minecraft can be obtained by fishing with a fishing rod. It can be cooked in a furnace.

cooked-cod.description: Cooked fish, also known as cooked cod, can be obtained by cooking a raw fish in a furnace in Minecraft.

cooked-salmon.description: Cooked salmon can be obtained by cooking a raw salmon in a furnace in Minecraft.

ink-sac.description: Ink sacs can be obtained by killing squid in Minecraft. They are the darkest form of dye.

rose-red.description: Rose red dye is a form of dye in Minecraft that can be used to change the color of blocks and items.

cactus-green.description: Cactus green dye is a form of dye in Minecraft that can be used to change the color of blocks and items.

cocoa-beans.description: Cocoa beans, whilst also a dye that can be used to change the color of blocks and items, is a farming item that can be used to make cookies. They can be found in jungles and grow only on jungle logs.

lapis-lazuli.description: Lapis lazuli is primarily a dye, but can also be used to make lapis lazuli blocks.

bone-meal.description: Bonemeal has multiple uses. It can be made by placing bones in a crafting table. It can be used as a dye (white) to color items and blocks. When right clicked on plants, seeds, or saplings, it accelerates their growth.

bone.description: Bones are dropped by skeletons on when they are killed. They can be used to create bonemeal and tame wolves.

sugar.description: Sugar is made by placing 1 sugar cane in the crafting table. It can be used to create fermented spider eyes, cakes and pumpkin pies.

properties.Recipes Used In: Cake, Fermented Spider Eye, Pumpkin Pie

cake.description: Cakes in Minecraft are a useful form of food that can be placed on top of a block. To eat a cake, right click the placed block.

white-bed.description: Beds in Minecraft can be made using wool and wooden planks. When slept in at night, they fast forward time to the morning. Beds also set your spawnpoint to their location (so when you die, you respawn there).

properties.Recipes Used In: Orange Bed, Magenta Bed, Light Blue Bed, Yellow Bed, Lime Bed, Pink Bed, Gray Bed, Light Gray Bed, Cyan Bed, Purple Bed, Blue Bed, Brown Bed, Green Bed, Red Bed, Black Bed

orange-bed.description: This is a regular bed that has been dyed with orange dye, making it an orange bed. Beds in Minecraft can be made using wool and wooden planks. When slept in at night, they fast forward time to the morning. Beds also set your spawnpoint to their location (so when you die, you respawn there).

cookie.description: Cookies can be made using 2 wheat and 1 cocoa beans. It is a cheap and simple form of food that restores 2 hunger.

map.description: Maps (filled) in Minecraft can be used to get a birds eye view of the world and find your way about. They can be made using 9 paper.

shears.description: Shears can be made using 2 iron ingots. They can be used to shear sheep (to obtain wool) and destroy leaves at an accelerated rate.

melon-slice.description: The melon item in Minecraft is dropped when the melon block is broken without a silk touch enchented item. It is a food and restores hunger levels when consumed.

properties.Recipes Used In: Melon, Melon Seeds, Glistering Melon Slice

dried-kelp.description: Dried kelp is created when regular kelp is smelted in a furnace. It can be consumed or used to create dry kelp blocks.

pumpkin-seeds.description: Pumpkin seeds can be planted on hoed land in Minecraft. Under the right conditions, the seeds will grow into a pumpkin block.

melon-seeds.description: Melon seeds can be planted on hoed land in Minecraft. Under the right conditions, the seeds will grow into a melon block.

raw-beef.description: Raw beef in Minecraft is dropped when a cow is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create steak, which is a food item.

steak.description: Cooked beef, or steak, in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw beef is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

raw-chicken.description: Raw chicken in Minecraft is dropped when a chicken is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked chicken, which is a food item.

cooked-chicken.description: Cooked chicken in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw chicken is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

rotten-flesh.description: Rotten flesh in Minecraft is a 'food item' that is dropped by zombies. Rotten flesh causes food poisoning for 30 seconds when consumed. It can also be used to tame wolves and trade with villagers.

ender-pearl.description: Enderpearls are dropped by endermen when they are killed. When right clicked, the will be thrown as a projectile and teleport you to the location at which they land.

blaze-rod.description: Blaze rods are dropped by blazes, which can be found in the nether. They can be used to create blaze powder, brewing stands and end rods.

properties.Recipes Used In: End Rod, Blaze Powder, Brewing Stand

ghast-tear.description: Ghast tears are dropped by ghasts when they are killed. They are a brewing ingredient and required to craft the end crystal.

gold-nugget.description: Golden nuggets can be made by placing a gold ingot in the crafting bench. They are used to create glistering melons for brewing, and many other items in Minecraft.

properties.Recipes Used In: Gold Ingot, Glistering Melon Slice, Golden Carrot

nether-wart.description: Nether warts can be farmed, and also used as a brewing and crafting ingredient. Unlike most farming product, they can only be grown on soul sand. They are used to make awkward potions.

properties.Recipes Used In: Nether Wart Block, Red Nether Bricks

potion.description: This is the default item that is used for potions in Minecraft. Potions can be consumed to give potion effects, both good and bad.

splash-potion.description: This is the default item that is used for splash potions in Minecraft. Splash potions will give people who are nearby to their impact when thrown a potion effect (relative to the splash potion type).

lingering-potion.description: Lingering potions can be used to leave a potion effect that 'lingers' on the ground for a longer period of time that a potion like a splash potion would.

awkward-potion.description: An awkward potion can be made using nether warts. It is used in the brewing recipes of many other potions, but has no other use outside of this.

thick-potion.description: A thick potion can be made with glowstone dust. It does not have any use in Minecraft as-of currently.

mundane-potion.description: A mundance potion can be made using many different items, including redstone, rabbits foot and many others. It currently doesn't have any use in Minecraft.

regeneration-potion-(0:45).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration potion effect will be applied for 45 seconds. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.

swiftness-potion-(3:00).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.

fire-resistance-potion-(3:00).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the fire resistance potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The fire resistance potion effect will prevent you from taking damage from flames and fire.

poison-potion-(0:45).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison potion effect will be applied for 45 seconds. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.. who would want to drink this?!

healing-potion.description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), some of your health will be restored. This potion applies the instant health effect, restoring 4 health points (2 hearts).

night-vision-potion-(3:00).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the night vision potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The night vision potion effect will allow you to see in the dark (so you do not need to place any light sources).

weakness-potion-(1:30).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the weakness potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The weakness potion effect decreases your damage output and increases the amount of damage your take from all attacks.

strength-potion-(3:00).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.

slowness-potion-(1:30).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the slowness will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The slowness potion effect is the exact opposite of the swiftness potion effect, and reduces the speed at which you can walk and run.

harming-potion.description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), your character will take damage. The potion will give you the instant damage potion effect, which causes you to take 6 points (3 hearts) of damage.

water-breathing-potion-(3:00).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the water breathing potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The water breathing potion effect allows you to 'breath underwater'. This means you won't take any damage from lack of breath whilst underwater whilst the potion effect is still active.

invisibility-potion-(3:00).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the invisibility potion effect will be applied for 3 minutes. The invisibility potion effect, as the name would suggest, makes you invisible.

regeneration-potion-ii-(0:22).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the regeneration 2 potion effect will be applied for 22 seconds. The regeneration potion effect decreases the time it takes for your health to restore.

swiftness-potion-ii-(1:30).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the swiftness (speed) 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The swiftness potion effect increases your speed and makes you run/walk faster than normal.

poison-potion-ii-(0:22).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the poison 2 potion effect will be applied for 22 seconds. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.

healing-potion-ii.description: When the healing 2 potion is consumed (via holding right click), some of your health will be restored. This potion applies the instant health effect 2, restoring 8 health points (4 hearts).

strength-potion-ii-(1:30).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the strength 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.

leaping-potion-ii-(1:30).description: When this potion is consumed (via holding right click), the leaping 2 potion effect will be applied for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The leaping potion effect makes your character jump higher than it can normally.

harming-potion-ii.description: When harming potion 2 is consumed (via holding right click), your character will take damage. The potion will give you the instant damage 2 potion effect, which causes you to take 12 points (6 hearts) of damage.

poison-ii-splash-(0:45)-potion.description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 45 seconds of the poison 2 potion effect to nearby entities. The poison potion effect causes damage every second until it expires.

strength-ii-splash-(3:00)-potion.description: Splash potions apply potion effects to those nearby when they collide with the ground. This splash potion will apply up to 3 minutes of the strength 2 potion effect to nearby entities. The strength potion effect increases the amount of damage you deal to mobs, players and other entities.

glass-bottle.description: Glass bottles in Minecraft are made using 3 glass blocks. They are used to make water bottles, which are required for brewing.

spider-eye.description: Spider eyes in Minecraft are used to create fermented spider eyes, and also as a brewing ingredient.

fermented-spider-eye.description: Fermented spider eyes are made with 1 sugar, 1 mushroom and 1 spider eye. They can be used as a brewing ingredient in Minecraft.

blaze-powder.description: Blaze powder can be made by placing a blaze rod in the crafting table in Minecraft. It is used as a brewing ingredient and to make eye of enders, fire charges and magma cream.

properties.Recipes Used In: Magma Cream, Eye of Ender, Fire Charge

magma-cream.description: Magma cream can be made using 1 slime ball and 1 blaze powder. It is used to create the magma block, and as a brewing ingredient for many potions.

brewing-stand.description: Brewing stands in Minecraft are essential items that are required to make potions. They are made using a blaze rod and 3 cobblestone blocks. When right clicked, they open the brewing stand interface.

cauldron.description: Cauldrons can be used to store water in Minecraft. They can be made using 7 iron ingots.

eye-of-ender.description: Eye of Enders in Minecraft are required to reach the end. They can be made using an enderpearl and 1 blaze powder. They are used to craft end crystals, along with enderchests.

glistering-melon-slice.description: Glistering melons, also known as speckled and sparkling melons, are used as a brewing ingredient in Minecraft. They can be crafted using a melon and 8 gold nuggets.

bat-spawn-egg.description: This spawn egg can be used to spawn a bat in Minecraft. To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

A phantom is a flying creature that becomes hostile towards players that haven't slept in three days (in-game, of course). To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

turtle-spawn-egg.description: This spawn egg can be used to spawn a turtle in Minecraft. Turtles were introduced in Update Aquatic (1.13) and spawn naturally within water. To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

zombie-spawn-egg.description: This spawn egg can be used to spawn a zombie in Minecraft. To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

zombie-horse-spawn-egg.description: This spawn egg can be used to spawn a zombie horse in Minecraft. To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

zombie-pigman-spawn-egg.description: This spawn egg can be used to spawn a zombie pig man in Minecraft. To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

zombie-villager-spawn-egg.description: This spawn egg can be used to spawn a zombie villager in Minecraft. To use a spawn egg, right click it on the ground. It cannot be obtained in Vanilla MC.

fire-charge.description: Fire charges can be made using 1 blaze powder, 1 gun powder and 1 charcoal. They are launched as a projectile fireball when dispensed from a dispenser in Minecraft.

book-and-quill.description: The book and quill in Minecraft can be used to write a book. To write inside, right click the book and a book interface will open. You must sign the book to save the contents.

written-book.description: The written book is obtained when book and quill is signed. The written book can be right clicked to open a book interface with the content of the signed book inside.

emerald.description: The emerald item can be obtained from both villagers and emerald ore which is only found in the extreme hills biome. It is mainly used to trade with villagers, as you can exchange emeralds with them for many useful items in Minecraft.

item-frame.description: Item frames in Minecraft can be used to.. frame items. They can be made using 1 leather item and 8 sticks. To put an item in an item frame, right click the item frame with the item you want to frame in your hand.

flower-pot.description: To make a flower pot, 3 bricks in Minecraft are required. You can place plants such as cacti and flowers in plant pots. To do this, right click a plant pot with the plant you want to put inside.

carrot.description: Carrots in Minecraft are foods item that can also be farmed. To plant a carrot, right click hoed dirt with the carrot item. To consume a carrot, hold right click with a carrot in your hand.

properties.Recipes Used In: Golden Carrot, Carrot on a Stick, Rabbit Stew

potato.description: Potatoes in Minecraft are a food item that can also be farmed. To plant a potato, right click hoed dirt with the carrot item. To consume a potato, hold right click with a carrot in your hand.

baked-potato.description: A baked potato can be made by putting a potato, with fuel, in a furnace. It restores more hunger than a regular potato, and cannot be planted.

poisonous-potato.description: Poisonous potatoes have a 1 in 50 chance of being dropped when a potato is farmed. They have a 60% chance of giving the poison potion effect when eaten, and cannot be replanted.

empty-map.description: Maps (empty) in Minecraft can be used to get a birds eye view of the world and find your way about. They can be made using 9 paper.

golden-carrot.description: Golden carrots in Minecraft can be made using a carrot and 8 golden ingots. They can be consumed, fed to animals and also are a brewing ingredient.

skeleton-skull.description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a skeleton.

wither-skeleton-skull.description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a wither skeleton.

player-head.description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a human or player. It can be assigned meta data to display the skin head of an actual username.

zombie-head.description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a zombie.

creeper-head.description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of a creeper.

dragon-head.description: This block is a decorative skull in Minecraft that represents the head of an enderdragon.

carrot-on-a-stick.description: This item can be used to lure pigs in Minecraft. It can be made by placing a carrot and a fishing rod in the crafting table.. creative, huh?

nether-star.description: Nether stars are required to make beacons and are dropped by the wither boss from the nether in Minecraft.

pumpkin-pie.description: Pumpkin pies are a food item that can be made with a pumpkin, 1 sugar and 1 egg. To consume the pumpkin pie, hold right click whilst the item is in your hand.

firework-rocket.description: Fireworks can be customized to make extravagant particle explosions in the game. This is the base item that is required to make them!

firework-star.description: Firework stars are made with dyes and gunpowder! A firework charge is the item that is used to customize the size, effect and color of a firework.

enchanted-book.description: Enchanted books in Minecraft are used to apply enchantments to items, without the need for an enchantment table. They cannot be crafted, but can be found in dungeons. An anvil is require to apply the enchantment specified by the book to an item.

nether-brick.description: Netherbricks can be made by smelting netherrack, with a fuel, in a furnace in Minecraft. They are used to create decorative blocks like the nether brick block.

properties.Recipes Used In: Nether Bricks, Nether Brick Fence, Red Nether Bricks

nether-quartz.description: Quartz can be obtained from quartz ore in the nether. It is used to create daylight sensors, along with other decorative blocks and redstone utilities.

properties.Recipes Used In: Granite, Diorite, Daylight Detector, Block of Quartz, Observer, Redstone Comparator

minecart-with-tnt.description: Minecarts with TNT are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with TNT inside. They cannot take a passenger. They can obviously be.. DETONATED!

minecart-with-hopper.description: Minecarts with hoppers are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with hoppers. They cannot take a passenger. When right clicked, they open up the hopper interface.

prismarine-shard.description: Prismarine shards are dropped by guardians and elder guardians. They can be used to create decorative prismarine blocks.

properties.Recipes Used In: Prismarine, Prismarine Bricks, Dark Prismarine, Sea Lantern

prismarine-crystals.description: Prismarine Crystals are dropped by guardians and elder guardians. They can be used to create decorative prismarine blocks.

raw-rabbit.description: Raw rabbit in Minecraft is dropped when a rabbit is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked rabbit, which is a food item.

cooked-rabbit.description: Cooked rabbit in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw rabbit is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

rabbit-stew.description: Rabbit stew is a food item that can be consumed to restore hunger. It is made using a bowl, mushroom, carrot, potato and of course.. a cooked rabbit.

rabbit-hide.description: Rabbit hide is dropped by a rabbit on death. 4 rabbit hides can be used to create leather.

armor-stand.description: An armor stand can be used to display and/or store armour. To put a piece of armour on an armor stand, right click the armor stand with the item in your hand.

iron-horse-armor.description: Horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.

golden-horse-armor.description: Gold horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.

diamond-horse-armor.description: Horse armor acts exactly like regular armor for players, but can be equipped by horses and provides them with extra defence.

lead.description: A lead can be attached to animals like horses and pigs to both move them about and fix them to fences so that they cannot run away.

name-tag.description: A name tag can be used to name a mob in Minecraft. Right click the mob with a name tag to set its name.

minecart-with-command-block.description: Minecarts with command blocks are, as the name would suggest, minecarts with command blocks inside. They cannot take a passenger.

raw-mutton.description: Raw mutton in Minecraft is dropped when a sheep is killed. It can be cooked in a furnace to create cooked mutton, which is a food item.

cooked-mutton.description: Cooked mutton in Minecraft is the item that is obtained when raw mutton is cooked in a furnace. It can be used to restore hunger levels.

white-banner.description: This is a white banner, made with white wool. Banners in Minecraft are decorative blocks that can be used to display patterns. The main constituent of patterns in banners is dye. Banners can be crafted using wool and a stick.

black-banner.description: This is a black banner, colored with black wool. Banners in Minecraft are decorative blocks that can be used to display patterns. The main constituent of patterns in banners is dye. Banners can be crafted using wool and a stick.

end-crystal.description: This is the block that represents the crystals that spawn on the top of columns in the end.

chorus-fruit.description: Chorus fruit can be both consumed, and cooked. When eaten, it will restore 4 hunger. It can be obtained from chorus plants, which grow naturally only in the end.

popped-chorus-fruit.description: Popper chorus fruit can be made by cooking chorus fruit. It is used as a crafting ingredient. It cannot be eaten.

beetroot.description: Beetroot is a food item that can be consumed to satiate your hunger. It can also be used to breed and lure pigs.

beetroot-seeds.description: Beetroot seeds are a farming item used to.. grow beetroot. To plant beetroot seeds, right click them on hoed dirt. Given the right lighting conditions and nearby water, they will grow into beetroot.

beetroot-soup.description: Beetroot soup can be made using a bowl, a mushroom and a beetroot. It is a food item that can be consumed to satiate your hunger levels.

spectral-arrow.description: When a spectral arrow hits a target, it creates an outline around the entity. This is useful as it provides an x-ray (in a sense), so that you do not lose your target.

tipped-arrow.description: Tipped arrows inflict a potion effect when they hit their target. There are many different arrows, each having an individual potion effect such as strength or poison.

shield.description: A shield in Minecraft can be crafted using 6 wooden planks and 1 iron ingot. It can be equipped in your off-hand to provide extra defence.

elytra.description: An elytra allows you to glide and fly in Minecraft. They are found only in end cities, and cannot be crafted. It is equipped in the chestplate armor slot.

spruce-boat.description: Spruce boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 spruce planks, and put on water by right click.

birch-boat.description: Birch boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 birch planks, and put on water by right click.

jungle-boat.description: Jungle boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 jungle planks, and put on water by right click.

acacia-boat.description: Acacia boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 acacia planks, and put on water by right click.

dark-oak-boat.description: Dark oak boats are useful as they allow fast transport across water. They can be made with 5 dark oak planks, and put on water by right click.

totem-of-undying.description: The totem of undying item is dropped by evokers in Minecraft. It will save a player from death if it is equipped when they die.

shulker-shell.description: The shulker shell is used to create shulker boxes (along with a chest) in Minecraft. It is dropped by.. shulkers!

iron-nugget.description: Iron nuggets can be made by placing an iron ingot in the crafting table in Minecraft. They have little to no use currently.

properties.Recipes Used In: Iron Ingot, Lantern, Chain, Soul Lantern

knowledge-book.description: This item can only be spawned in using its spawn commands that are found on this page. This book can be used to unlock crafting recipes (if they are locked, for example by the doLimitedCrafting gamerule).

debug-stick.description: This item can be spawned in using its spawn commands that are found on this page. It can be used to edit block states - simply hit a block with it to cycle through blockstates, shifting and hitting a block will cycle through blockstates in reverse order.

13-disc.description: This music dic plays record '13'. Music discs can be found in dungeons in Vanilla Minecraft. When right clicked on a jukebox, the track of the music disc, or record, plays.

wait-disc.description: This music dic plays record 'wait'. Music discs can be found in dungeons in Vanilla Minecraft. When right clicked on a jukebox, the track of the music disc, or record, plays.

trident.description: The trident is dropped by drowneds and can be picked up if thrown. It can be used as both a melee weapon and ranged (by throwing it). It can be thrown by holding right click until fully charged.

phantom-membrane.description: The phantom membrane is sometimes dropped by phantoms when they are killed. It can be used to repair the elytra and as a brewing ingredient in the slow falling potion

nautilus-shell.description: The only use of this item currently is in the crafting recipe of conduits. They can be obtained via fishing and rarely, by drowneds.

heart-of-the-sea.description: This item cannot be crafted, it can only be found within buried treasure chests. It can be used to craft a conduit by placing it in the center of a crafting bench surrounded by 8 nautilus shells.

water.description: The still water block is the block that is created when you right click a water bucket. This item is not available in Vanilla Minecraft, or creative mode. It must be spawned in with the /give command.

lava.description: The still lava block is the block that is created when you right click a lava bucket. This item is not available in Vanilla Minecraft, or creative mode. It must be spawned in with the /give command.

tall-seagrass.description: Tall seagrass is a taller (2 block high) variant of regular sea grass. It grows underwater.

piston-head.description: A piston head is no obtainable in Vanilla Minecraft. It is the block that is pushed outwards from a regular piston when it is activated.

moving-piston.description: The piston extension block is not obtainable in vanilla Minecraft. It is a block added in Minecraft 1.13, but is invisible, cannot be broken easily (you have to use commands/TNT) and is not solid.

wall-torch.description: This is the block that takes the place of a torch when it is placed on a wall.

fire.description: Fire is the block that takes the place of fire in Minecraft. Whilst this block cannot be spawned into your inventory in Minecraft, it is created when you right click with a flint and steel on the ground, or in other situations like when blaze shoots.

redstone-dust.description: Redstone wire is the block that is created when redstone is right clicked on the ground. It cannot be crafted or obtained in Vanilla Minecraft as an item. Its primary function is to carry redstone current.

wall-sign.description: The wall mounted sign block is the block that is created when you right click a sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a regular sign item.

redstone-wall-torch.description: This is an unobtainable item (it cannot be inside your inventory). It takes the place of a redstone torch when you place it on a wall.

nether-portal.description: The portal block is created when a nether portal is formed in Minecraft. When stood in for 3 seconds, a user is teleported to the nether. This block cannot be obtained as an item in Vanilla Minecraft. It is commonly used on Minecraft server hubs as a portal.

attached-pumpkin-stem.description: This is an unobtainable block (it cannot be placed in your inventory). It takes the place of a pumpkin stem when attached to a pumpkin.

attached-melon-stem.description: This is an unobtainable block (it cannot be placed in your inventory). It takes the place of a melon stem when attached to a melon.

pumpkin-stem.description: Pumpkin stem blocks are not obtainable as items in Vanilla Minecraft. They are the block that is generated in the world to show the growth progress of a pumpkin plant.

melon-stem.description: Melon stem blocks are not obtainable as items in Vanilla Minecraft. They are the block that is generated in the world to show the growth progress of a melon plant.

end-portal.description: The end portal block cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft but is used by Minecraft to display the 'end portal effect'. It also is useful as a light source in Minecraft builds as it cannot be seen when looked at from below. The end portal block can be spawned in using WorldEdit (as it cannot be obtained as an inventory item). The item image shown below is the incorrect image. This item is the end portal block, not the nether portal block.

cocoa.description: The cocoa block cannot be obtained in Vanilla Minecraft - it is the block that grows on trees when cocoa beans are planted. When broken, cocoa beans are dropped (the amount is based on how much the cocoa bean block has grown). It is a useful ingredient in several crafting recipes, such as dyes.

tripwire.description: Tripwire in Minecraft can be used in redstone circuits to detect entities.

potted-oak-sapling.description: This item represents a plant pot with an oak sapling inside of it.

potted-spruce-sapling.description: This item represents a plant pot with a spruce sapling inside of it.

potted-birch-sapling.description: This item represents a plant pot with a birch sapling inside of it.

potted-jungle-sapling.description: This item represents a plant pot with a jungle sapling inside of it.

potted-acacia-sapling.description: This item represents a plant pot with an acacia sapling inside of it.

potted-dark-oak-sapling.description: This item represents a plant pot with a dark oak sapling inside of it.

potted-fern.description: This item represents a plant pot with a fern inside of it.

potted-dandelion.description: This item represents a plant pot with a dandelion flower inside of it.

potted-poppy.description: This item represents a plant pot with a poppy flower inside of it.

potted-blue-orchid.description: This item represents a plant pot with a blue orchid flower inside of it.

potted-allium.description: This item represents a plant pot with a allium flower inside of it.

potted-azure-bluet.description: This item represents a plant pot with an azure bluet flower inside of it.

potted-red-tulip.description: This item represents a plant pot with a red tulip flower inside of it.

potted-orange-tulip.description: This item represents a plant pot with an orange tulip flower inside of it.

potted-white-tulip.description: This item represents a plant pot with a white tulip flower inside of it.

potted-pink-tulip.description: This item represents a plant pot with a pink tulip flower inside of it.

potted-oxeye-daisy.description: This item represents a plant pot with an oxeye daisy flower inside of it.

potted-red-mushroom.description: This item represents a plant pot with a red mushroom inside of it.

potted-brown-mushroom.description: This item represents a plant pot with a brown mushroom inside of it.

potted-dead-bush.description: This item represents a plant pot with a dead bush inside of it.

potted-cactus.description: This item represents a plant pot with a cactus inside of it.

carrots.description: This is the carrot crop block that spawns when the carrot item is right clicked on hoed land. It cannot be obtained as an item. When broken (it breaks instantly with any item), it drops the carrot item.

potatoes.description: This is the potatoes crop block that spawns when the potato item is right clicked on hoed land. It cannot be obtained as an item. When broken (it breaks instantly with any item), it drops the potato item.

skeleton-wall-skull.description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the skeleton mob head item when it is placed in the world.

wither-skeleton-wall-skull.description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the wither mob head item when it is placed in the world.

zombie-wall-head.description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the zombie head item when it is placed in the world.

player-wall-head.description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the player head item when it is placed in the world.

creeper-wall-head.description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the creeper head item when it is placed in the world.

dragon-wall-head.description: This is an unobtainable block. It is the block that takes the place of the dragon head item when it is placed in the world.

beetroots.description: Beetroot in Minecraft is a grown vegetable similar to carrots and potatos, this block is what appears in the world when it is placed and growing.

end-gateway.description: The end gateway is the portal block that is used to teleport players from the end world to the overworld, and vice versa. It can also be used as a decorative block because of its beam.

frosted-ice.description: The frosted ice block has all the same properties as a regular Minecraft ice block. It melts faster than regular ice dependent on light - meaning in dark places it will not melt.

kelp-plant.description: This is the block that takes the place of kelp when it grows. Kelp can grow as high as there is water above it.

void-air.description: This is the block that takes the place of empty air in the void.

cave-air.description: This is the block that takes the place of empty air inside caves

bubble-column.description: Bubble columns spawn naturally, and can be generated by placing either soul sand or magma blocks underwater. They can be used to move entities such as items in the direction they are pushing/pulling in.

creeper-spawner.description: This is the item ID for a creeper spawner which is a mob spawner. Mob spawners, or monster spawners, are blocks that spawn mobs when placed. Conditions (e.g. light levels) relative to the mob type of the spawner must still be met in order for the monster to spawn. They are often used in grinders, and can be found in dungeons but cannot be mined in Vanilla Minecraft.

skeleton-spawner.description: This is the item ID for a skeleton spawner which is a mob spawner. Mob spawners, or monster spawners, are blocks that spawn mobs when placed. Conditions (e.g. light levels) relative to the mob type of the spawner must still be met in order for the monster to spawn. bee-spawn-egg.description: As the name suggests, the Bee Spawn Egg will spawn a bee when you hold the item in your hand and right click a block. Bees are naturally non-aggressive mobs that won't attack unless provoked. When provoked (i.e. if you hit them), they will attempt to sting, and if successful, poison you. Bees are also crucial to bee hives.

honeycomb.description: The Honeycomb item was brought along in Minecraft 1.15 and can be harvested from both bee hives and bee nests. To obtain this item (without spawn commands) you will have to shear a hive or nest which can result in the inhabitants (bees!) attacking.

bee-nest.description: Bees nests naturally spawn on trees and house a colony of bees. They can be used to obtain honeycombs. Trees in Plains and Sunflower Plains biomes are much more likely to house a bees nest, but as these have low amounts of trees, your best chance of *encountering* a bee nest is within the Flower Forest biome (within which, 1 in every 50 trees will be home to a bees nest).

beehive.description: Bee hives are similar to bees nests in that they house bees, but they do not spawn naturally and must be crafted. Bees who are pollinated will naturally fly into bee hives and start to produce honeycombs. Once ready, these honeycombs can be harvested by using sheers on the block. The crafting recipe for bee hives can be found on this page and requires both planks and honeycombs.

honey-bottle.description: Honey bottles are craftable items that will restore 6 hunger (3 total hunger points) and will also clear any poison potion effects when consumed.

honey-block.description: Honey blocks require 4 honey bottles to craft. They are transparent, sticky blocks that will slow any mobs and players down when in contact with them.

honeycomb-block.description: Honeycomb blocks are blocks made from 4 honeycombs. Having no function, these blocks are currently only decorational. You cannot convert these blocks back into their original crafting ingredients (in the same way that you would with a diamond block).

oak-wall-sign.description: The oak wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click an oak sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops an oak sign item.

spruce-wall-sign.description: The spruce wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a spruce sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a spruce sign item.

birch-wall-sign.description: The birch wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a birch sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a birch sign item.

acacia-wall-sign.description: The acacia wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click an acacia sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops an acacia sign item.

jungle-wall-sign.description: The jungle wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a jungle sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a jungle sign item.

dark-oak-wall-sign.description: The dark oak wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a dark oak sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a dark oak sign item.

potted-cornflower.description: This is the block that represents a potted cornflower when you place a cornflower in a flower pot.

potted-lily-of-the-valley.description: This is the block that represents a potted lily of the valley when you place a lily of the valley in a flower pot.

potted-wither-rose.description: This is the block that represents a potted wither rose when you place a wither rose in a flower pot.

bamboo-sapling.description: Bamboo saplings can be obatained by breaking bamboo trees. Bamboo trees naturally spawn within jungles and give you bamboo when broken. When you right click a bamboo sapling on the ground, it will be placed. After placing a bamboo sapling, provided conditions are satisfactory, it will grow into a bamboo plant.

potted-bamboo.description: This is the block that represents a potted bamboo when you place a bamboo in a flower pot.

sweet-berry-bush.description: This is the block that represents a sweet berry bush after it has either naturally generated or grown from a sweet berry seed.

crimson-nylium.description: Crimson nylium generates naturally in the Crimson Forest Nether biome (introduced in Minecraft 1.16).

warped-nylium.description: Warped nylium generates naturally in the Warped Forest Nether biome (introduced in Minecraft 1.16).

crimson-planks.description: Crimson planks are made by placing either a crimson stem or a stripped crimson stem into the crafting grid. They are very similar to other variants of planks however, as they originate from the Nether, they are not useable as fuel (as they don't burn!).
