nether-gold-ore.description: Nether gold ore is similar to normal gold ore but only spawns in the Nether. When mined, it will yield 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 gold ore items. Piglins, a mob native to the Nether, will attack if they notice you mining this block.

crimson-stem.description: Crimson stems are the 'wood' of the trees (Huge crimson fungus) that grow in the Nether. As is the case with wood, axes are the fastest way to break this block.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Crimson Hyphae, Soul Campfire

warped-stem.description: Warped stems are the 'wood' of the trees (Huge warped fungus) that grow in the Nether. As is the case with wood, axes are the fastest way to break this block.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Warped Hyphae, Soul Campfire

stripped-crimson-stem.description: This is the stripped variant of a crimson stem. It can be obtained by right clicking a crimson stem (when on the ground/in a huge fungus) and then cutting it with an axe.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Stripped Crimson Hyphae, Soul Campfire

stripped-warped-stem.description: This is the stripped variant of a warped stem. It can be obtained by right clicking a warped stem (when on the ground/in a huge fungus) and then cutting it with an axe.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Stripped Warped Hyphae, Soul Campfire

stripped-crimson-hyphae.description: Stripped crimson hyphae is made from stripped crimsons stems.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Soul Campfire

stripped-warped-hyphae.description: Stripped warped hyphae is made from stripped warped stems.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Soul Campfire

crimson-hyphae.description: Crimson hyphae is made from crimson stems.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Crimson Planks, Soul Campfire

warped-hyphae.description: Warped hyphae is made from warped stems.

properties.Recipes Used In: Smoker, Campfire, Warped Planks, Soul Campfire

crimson-fungus.description: Crimson fungus is effectively the Nether's version of a mushroom (along with warped fungus). It can be found within the crimson and warped forest biomes, but you are more likely to find this variant in the crimson forest.

warped-fungus.description: Warped fungus is effectively the Nether's version of a mushroom (along with crimson fungus). It can be found within the crimson and warped forest biomes, but you are more likely to find this variant in the warped forest.

crimson-roots.description: Crimson roots are native to the Nether and spawn within the crimson forest biome (and in rare cases, the warped forest or soul sand valley biomes). It is mainly a decorative block but can be placed in a composter.

warped-roots.description: Warped roots are native to the Nether and spawn within the warped forest biome (and in rare cases, the crimson forest or soul sand valley biomes). It is mainly a decorative block but can be placed in a composter.

nether-sprouts.description: Nether sprouts, as the name suggests, are items that spawn in the Nether within the warped forest biome. They can be used on a composter.

weeping-vines.description: Weeping vines are similar to normal vines in that they can be climbed, but are native to the Nether and only spawn in the crimson forest biome (on huge crimson fungi, and also on the ceilings).

twisting-vines.description: Twisting vines are similar to normal vines in that they can be climbed, but are native to the Nether and only spawn in the warped forest biome (on huge warped fungi, and also on the ceilings).

crimson-slab.description: A crimson slab block can be crafted by placing 3 crimson planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

warped-slab.description: A warped slab block can be crafted by placing 3 warped planks in a row in the crafting table. Slabs are useful in Minecraft as they as an essential ingredient in many crafting recipes and can be used to move upwards smoothly, without needing to jump.

crimson-pressure-plate.description: This is the crimson plank variant of a pressure plate. It has similar properties to a normal pressure plate.

warped-pressure-plate.description: This is the warped plank variant of a pressure plate. It has similar properties to a normal pressure plate.

polished-blackstone-pressure-plate.description: This is the polished blackstone variant of a pressure plate. It has similar properties to a normal pressure plate.

crimson-fence.description: Crimson fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence, made with crimson planks instead of normal planks. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table

warped-fence.description: Warped fences in Minecraft are a variant of a regular fence, made with warped planks instead of normal planks. Fences are blocks that cannot be jumped over. To craft this fence, place 4 wood planks (relative to type of fence) and 2 sticks in the crafting table

soul-soil.description: Soul soil is a block native to the Nether, specifically the soul sand valley biome. It has many unique uses, including turning flames/fire ignited on it into soul fire, interchangeable with soul sand when spawning a wither, and the production of basalt.

basalt.description: Basalt is a decorative block that spawns within the Nether. You can find it in the soul sand valley biome as a constituent of basalt pillars. It can also be generated using soul soil and lava.

polished-basalt.description: Polished basalt is a decorative block that can be made by placing four basalt in a square formation within a crafting grid.

soul-torch.description: Soul torches are similar to normal torches but are crafted using soul sand or soul soil in the bottom slot instead of a stick. They produce a smaller amount of light when compared to a normal torch, but will scare Piglins within 7 blocks of a torch away.

crimson-trapdoor.description: The crimson trapdoor is a variant of a normal trapdoor but is instead crafted using 6 crimson planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

warped-trapdoor.description: The warped trapdoor is a variant of a normal trapdoor but is instead crafted using 6 warped planks. It is a vertical (1x1 block) door that can be opened and closed by right click or by redstone activation.

chain.description: Chains are crafted using 2 iron nuggets and 1 iron ingot. Although mainly decorative, they have some unique functions as they are not broken by pistons when pushed, and can also be attached to bells and laturns.

crimson-fence-gate.description: Crimson fence gates in Minecraft are the crimson wood variant of normal fence gates. They are the same as wooden fence gates but they are crafted using crimson planks. They can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

warped-fence-gate.description: Warped fence gates in Minecraft are the crimson wood variant of normal fence gates. They are the same as wooden fence gates but they are crafted using warped planks. They can be connected to fences, and used in a similar way to a door in the sense that can can be opened/closed. They cannot be jumped over.

cracked-nether-bricks.description: Cracked nether bricks are decorative items that can be crafted by placing regular nether bricks within a furnace.

chiseled-nether-bricks.description: Chiseled nether bricks are decorative items that can be crafted by placing two netherbrick slabs on top of eachother in a crafting grid.

crimson-stairs.description: Crimson stairs are a variant of wooden stairs and can be made by placing 6 crimson planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

warped-stairs.description: Warped stairs are a variant of wooden stairs and can be made by placing 6 warped planks in the crafting bench. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

blackstone-wall.description: Blackstone walls are similar to stone walls, but made with the native Nether block, blackstone. Walls can be used like fences as low-height blocks that prevent players and mobs jumping over.

polished-blackstone-wall.description: Polished blackstone walls are similar to blackstone walls but are instead crafted with polished blackstone. Walls can be used like fences as low-height blocks that prevent players and mobs jumping over.

polished-blackstone-brick-wall.description: Polished blackstone brick walls are similar to blackstone walls but are instead crafted with polished blackstone bricks. Walls can be used like fences as low-height blocks that prevent players and mobs jumping over.

crimson-button.description: Crimson buttons are a variant of wooden buttons that are made using a crimson plank (instead of a regular plank). Like wooden buttons, they can be used to activate blocks and redstone circuits.

warped-button.description: Warped buttons are a variant of wooden buttons that are made using a warped plank (instead of a regular plank). Like wooden buttons, they can be used to activate blocks and redstone circuits.

polished-blackstone-button.description: Polished blackstone buttons are a variant of stone buttons that are made using a polished blackstone block (instead of regular stone). Like stone buttons, they can be used to activate blocks and redstone circuits.

quartz-bricks.description: Quartz bricks are decorative blocks made with 4 quartz blocks.

warped-wart-block.description: Warped wart blocks spawn naturally within the warped forest biome. They are similar to the nether wart block, which is also native to the Nether. Unlike, the nether wart block, they don't prevent mobs from spawning on top of them.

crimson-door.description: Crimsons doors in Minecraft are a variant of wooden doors made with crimson planks. Standing at two blocks in height, they can be opened and closed by right clicking the block. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

warped-door.description: Warped doors in Minecraft are a variant of wooden doors made with warped planks. Standing at two blocks in height, they can be opened and closed by right clicking the block. To place a door, right click the door item on the ground. If the supporting block underneath a door is broken, the door will also break.

netherite-ingot.description: Netherite ingots are crafted using netherite scraps and golden ingots. They are used as a crafting ingredient in both the lodestone and the block of netherite. When paired with a diamond item in a smithing table, an equivalent netherite tool will be yielded.

netherite-scrap.description: Netherite scraps can be obtained by smelting ancient debris. They are used to created netherite ingots. Naturally, they may spawn within treasure chests, generic chests, and hoglin stable chests within Bastion remnants.

netherite-sword.description: The netherite sword is the best melee weapon in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond sword.

netherite-shovel.description: The netherite shovel is the best shovel in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond shovel.

netherite-pickaxe.description: The netherite pickaxe is the best pickaxe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond pickaxe.

netherite-axe.description: The netherite axe is the best axe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond axe.

netherite-hoe.description: The netherite hoe is the best hoe in the game and can be made by placing a netherite ingot into a smithing table along with a diamond hoe.

netherite-helmet.description: Requiring a diamond helmet and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, the netherite helmet is currently the best helmet in the game.

netherite-chestplate.description: Requiring a diamond chestplate and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, the netherite chestplate is currently the best body armor in the game.

netherite-leggings.description: Requiring diamond leggings and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, netherite leggings are currently the best leg armor in the game.

netherite-boots.description: Requiring diamond boots and a netherite ingot to be paired together in a smithing table, netherite boots are currently the best defence item for the foot slot in the game.

crimson-sign.description: The crimson sign is a variant of a regular sign made with crimson planks. It can be placed on the floor, or on a block, and have a message written on.

warped-sign.description: The warped sign is a variant of a regular sign made with warped planks. It can be placed on the floor, or on a block, and have a message written on.

hoglin-spawn-egg.description: Hoglin spawn eggs can be right clicked on the ground to spawn a Hoglin. Hoglins are mobs native to the Nether that are aggressive. When killed, they will drop leather and raw porkchop.

piglin-spawn-egg.description: The Piglin spawn egg is an item that, when right clicked on a block, will spawn a piglin mob. Piglins are aggressive mobs that usually only spawn within the Nether. They are aggressive towards any players that aren't wearing an item of golden armor.

strider-spawn-egg.description: Strider spawn eggs are items used to spawn Striders. They can be activated by right clicking on a block with the spawn egg in your character's hand. Striders are mobs that usually only spawn in the Nether. Water and rain will harm Striders. They are passive mobs.

zoglin-spawn-egg.description: When right clicked on a block, this item will spawn a zoglin mob. A zoglin is created when a regular hoglin enters a world other than the Nether (and stays there for more than 15 seconds). They are extremely aggressive mobs.

zombified-piglin-spawn-egg.description: This item will spawn a zombified piglin mob when right clicked on a block. Zombified piglins are mobs that will only attack if provoked.

warped-fungus-on-a-stick.description: This item functions similarly to a carrot on a stick, but instead of directing pigs, it can be used to direct Striders when they are being ridden. It is crafted with a regular fishing rod and warped fungus.

music-disc.description: Music discs can be placed into jukeboxes to play a music track. This disc in particular will play the Pigstep track. This item is only found within the Nether, inside bastion remnants.

soul-lantern.description: Soul lanterns emit the same amount of light as soul torches, 10. They can be hung or placed on many blocks, including chains.

soul-campfire.description: The soul campfire is a variant of the campfire that is made using soul sand or soul soil instead of coal. Its flames are blue in color.

shroomlight.description: The shroomlight is a powerful light source, emitting a light level of 15. It sometimes spawns naturally on top of huge fungi (both crimson and warped variants).

lodestone.description: Lodestones are made using 8 chiseled stone bricks and 1 netherite ingot. When a compass is right clicked on a lodestone, it will then point towards that lodestone.

block-of-netherite.description: A block of netherite can be crafted by placing 9 netherite ingots in a crafting grid. It can be changed back into its original ingredients, making it useful for efficient storage.

ancient-debris.description: Ancient debris is the rarest ore in the game, only spawning in the Nether and at a rare rate. It can be smelted to yield 2 netherite scrap.

target.description: Targets are blocks that will emit a redstone charge when a projectile hits them. The redstone charge will be emitted for for 0.4 seconds (4 redstone ticks).

crying-obsidian.description: Crying obsidian originates in the Nether within ruined portals and chests found inside basion remnants. It is a crucial ingredient in the crafting recipe for a respawn anchor.

blackstone.description: Blackstone is often dubbed 'the Nether's cobblestone' as it is native to the Nether and shares many similar properties. They can be found within basalt deltas and bastion remnants. They can replace cobblestone in crafting recipes.

properties.Recipes Used In: Furnace, Stone Sword, Stone Shovel, Stone Pickaxe, Stone Axe, Stone Hoe, Blackstone Wall, Blackstone Slab, Blackstone Stairs, Polished Blackstone

blackstone-slab.description: Blackstone slabs are a variant of stone slabs, being crafted by placing 3 blackstone in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

blackstone-stairs.description: Blackstone stairs are a variant of stone stairs and can be made by placing 6 blackstone in a crafting grid in the correct formation. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

gilded-blackstone.description: Gilded blackstone, being native to the Nether, spawns within bastion remnants. When mined, it may drop itself or 2, 3, 4, or 5 golden nuggets.

polished-blackstone.description: Polished blackstone is a decorative block that can be crafted by placing 4 blackstone in a crafting grid.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Blackstone Pressure Plate, Polished Blackstone Wall, Polished Blackstone Button, Polished Blackstone Slab, Polished Blackstone Stairs, Polished Blackstone Bricks

polished-blackstone-slab.description: Polished blackstone slabs are a variant of blackstone slabs, being crafted by placing 3 polished blackstone in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

polished-blackstone-stairs.description: Polished blackstone stairs are a variant of blackstone stairs and can be made by placing 6 polished blackstone in a crafting grid in the correct formation. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

chiseled-polished-blackstone.description: Chiseled polished blackstone is a decorative block that can be crafted by placing two polished blackstone slabs on top of eachother in a crafting grid.

polished-blackstone-bricks.description: Polished blackstone bricks are a decorative block that can be crafted by placing 4 polished blackstone in a crafting grid.

properties.Recipes Used In: Polished Blackstone Brick Wall, Polished Blackstone Brick Slab, Polished Blackstone Brick Stairs

polished-blackstone-brick-slab.description: Polished blackstone brick slabs are a variant of polished blackstone slabs, being crafted by placing 3 polished blackstone bricks in a vertical line in the crafting table. They are primarily used as a decorative block.

polished-blackstone-brick-stairs.description: Polished blackstone brick stairs are a variant of polished blackstone stairs and can be made by placing 6 polished blackstone bricks in a crafting grid in the correct formation. Stairs allow players to move up a block smoothly, without jumping.

cracked-polished-blackstone-bricks.description: Cracked polished blackstone bricks are a decorative variant of polished blackstone bricks. They are created by smelting blackstone bricks in a furance (or equivalent).

respawn-anchor.description: The respawn anchor is an item that allows you to respawn at its location in the Nether. As beds don't work in the Nether, this item is crucial for those setting up a base in the Nether world. It can be crafted using 6 crying obsidian and 3 glowstone.

soul-fire.description: Soul fire is a block that cannot be obtained in item form. It is created when a fire is started on top of soul sand or soul soil.

soul-wall-torch.description: The soul wall torch is a block variant (cannot be obtained in item form) of the soul torch that is created when you place a soul torch on a wall.

weeping-vines-plant.description: This is the block form of the weeping vines item that is created when weeping vines are dangled (not in contact with a wall). It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory.

twisting-vines-plant.description: This is the block form of the twisting vines item that is created when twisting vines are dangled (not in contact with a wall). It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory.

crimson-wall-sign.description: The crimson wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a crimson sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a crimson sign item.

warped-wall-sign.description: The warped wall sign block is the block that is created when you right click a warped sign on the outwards face of a block. It cannot be obtained as an item in your inventory in Vanilla Minecraft. When broken, it drops a warped sign item.

potted-crimson-fungus.description: This is the block that represents a potted crimson fungus when you place a crimson fungus in a flower pot.

potted-warped-fungus.description: This is the block that represents a potted warped fungus when you place a warped fungus in a flower pot.

potted-crimson-roots.description: This is the block that represents a potted crimson root when you place a crimson root in a flower pot.

potted-warped-roots.description: This is the block that represents a potted warped root when you place a warped root in a flower pot.
